story:
Our Story                                      

The About Face Collective is working to create a community rooftop garden and learning space with a twist: the creative structural elements of the garden will be designed and built by local artists and youth using recycled and reclaimed materials. Together withSkate4Cancer's "You Are What You Eat" program, Sketch Working Arts for Street Involved and Homeless Youth, and the Centre for Social Innovation, The About Face Collective will create a unique, inspiring, visually exciting space to promote urban farming, green lifestyles and integrated community engagement.

We are seeking to create a 2200 square foot deck on the roof of the Centre for Social Innovation, Annex location at 720 Bathurst St, Toronto. The deck will hold raised beds, vertical gardening structures, community lounge and education area, all surrounded by green roof space. Our layout considers plotting for food production while also providing adequate amount of space for community use, events and educational programming.

The Impact                                  

This rooftop will have long lasting environmental and social impacts. Here's a quick look at what we can achieve with this project:


Environmental Impact: Converting black tar rooftop space into green space helps reduce storm water runoff and also the "heat island" effect which contributes to smog and poor air quality in urban spaces. Not to mention, more plants in any situation equals more absorption of CO2, also leading to more breathable air.  We'll also be putting rain barrels on the roof which will help conserve water. And, last but not least, we'll be growing food, selling it in the building below and using it on-site in educational programming, effectively ELIMINATING the emissions it normally takes to transport produce into urban areas!

By showcasing the creative and functional possibilities of materials often thought of as disposable, we hope to inspire waste reduction. Not only will we reduce landfill waste ourselves, but also to inspire others to see the amazing aesthetic and practical potential that exists for recycling and reusing.

Social Impact: We'll be giving youth, artists and other community members unique educational and employment opportunities throughout this project. Educational programming will be offered in the initial development process in the form of workshops, so that interested community members learn about different stages of creating a rooftop garden.

We're teaming with local artists including the crew at Sketch Working Arts for Street Involved and Homeless Youth. We'll be offering paid residencies to youth who are passionate and artistic but are encountering barriers to employment. These opportunities give them unique and exciting job experience which can help launch them into future careers in creative or environmental sectors. 

Our regular scheduled programming, in partnership with Skate4Cancer, will take the form of half-day educational sessions for school and community groups. Programs will focus on agriculture and urban gardening education, sustainable art and design, nutritional information and simple, healthy food preparation. The programming will seek to show the food process in its full cycle, from seed to meal. We will take a creative approach to food education, integrating art, nutrition and sustainable possibilities. Fun!

The space will also be open to the general public and available for rental for special events, workshops and gatherings. It will serve as a unique and artistically inspired space that will appeal to a wide variety of communities in the GTA. 
 


What We Need                             

We've already hosted a successful fundraiser,  gained the support of Live Green Toronto, The Big Carrot, and lots of support from our own community members. We're applying for grants and sponsorships like it's our job, but we still need support from you! We've got some dough to go to reach our full fundraising goals to cover our budget of $240,000. 


Where does that number come from? Well, not only are we creating the rooftop deck, but we also need to build all the necessary drainage equipment and underlying structure to make sure the deck can support the weight of the garden and green roof elements. This requires not only quality equipment, but also services from sustainability specialists, including architects, engineers and contractors.  We'll also need to construct appropriate access to the roof (right now there's only a ladder; eek!). 


As mentioned, we also want to employ youth and local artists (with decent wages!) to help design, build and bring artistic sensibilities to the space. We believe in the value of creative work and in the potential for artists to bring important social and environmental issues to light, to make them exciting and attractive to the community. 


We'll also need to buy tools, create educational resources, and of course seeds, plants, lightweight soil alternatives and other garden-related items. It all adds up fast!


Other Ways You Can Help          

Please help us spread the word! Share our campaign with your friends who care about the environment, art, youth, culture, food, health, the Earth, and, well, EVERYTHING! 


If you're in the Toronto area and would like to volunteer your skills to this project, holler! Add your passion to our growing group of diverse and passionate community members.


Perks will be sent at the close of the campaign.


Relevant perk links:

freshcityfarms.com

laurenpirie.com

story:
Short Summary

For three years Slovak filmmaker of wild nature Erik Baláž, together with his friends Karol Kaliský and Jozef Fiala, trekked the length and breadth of the mountains and forests of Eastern Carpathians, a region that straddles Slovakia, Poland and Ukraine. They were searching for elusive wolves and other extraordinary animals, which share this territory.


They discovered a world almost untouched by people. Ancient people once revered the wolf and lived side by side. In later centuries, hunters hunted for wolves to their near extinction and farmers occupied more and more land. Only the most resilient plants and animals survived this onslaught. Today Erik’s team records a precious portrait of a wilderness as if reborn from the ashes and uncovers this unique ecosystem.

This is the story about the rebirth of European wilderness, in which the wolf, the wisent, the bear and other rare animals live as freely as centuries ago. Take a look with us into the wild area of the Eastern Carpathians, formerly known as THE WOLF MOUNTAINS.

What We Need & What You Get

The premiere of the film Wolf Mountains is scheduled for October 2013.

Currently the filmmaking work is almost completed and the team is working on the postproduction of the film.

We believe that both the Slovak and the English version of the film will have their premiere in October.

The English version should have its premiere on the WILD 10 Festival in Salamanca (Spain).

The venue for the Slovak premiere is not decided yet.

We need your support in terms of finalize the film and to release it.

Your contribution (5€, 10€ or 15€) will be used for financing the postproduction and film release. According to the amount you will get
- our great "Thank You" with your name highlighted on our web      
  site http://www.arollafilm.com or
- Wolf Mountains DVD or
- Wolf Mountains BlueRay.

 

The Impact

We would like to attract the attention to our Slovak beautiful nature, namely the area of Eastern Carpathians in order to enforce the knowledge about the nature as well as increase the awareness of the people and stress the need that we have to protect it.

No one else can, but we, humans.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute by those amounts, please tell your friends, relatives and coworkers about it. Spread our campaign using Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Three years ago we read a news article about plans to build a 6-lane toll road that would run straight through a State Park outside of San Diego.  We were shocked.  How could an argument to obstruct a State Park even be on the table?  Didn’t dozens sacrifice everything years ago to create these places as parks in order to preserve their beauty and heritage for all of us…forever?

We quickly wrote a letter to decision-making park supporters suggesting that if this argument was serious, something was “off.”  If they agreed on the importance of getting word out on how important these places are –how invaluable they are now and into the future – and how at risk they could be – a film on the subject might inspire people to keep it that way.  

The powers that be said yes. Within a year, amazingly, we succeeded in raising productions funds and began filming.

In the end, after visiting nearly 100 state parks and shooting for 61 days in 47 parks, we produced a two-part “limited series” called CALIFORNIA FOREVER for PBS.  Two one-hour programs tell the story of California State Parks, the most diverse state park system in the nation.  Episode One celebrates its sweeping history and Episode Two explores the challenges state and national parks across the country will face in the next century.

We have finally completed both episodes of CALIFORNIA FOREVER and PBS will broadcast the programs nationally this fall.  THIS IS HUGE !! We cannot tell you how excited we are to get these programs finished and out into the world.  It is the culmination of hundreds of people and their commitment to California State Parks, as well as their labor over the last three years.  

Short Summary

David Vassar and I of Backcountry Pictures are passionate about producing programs that impart a sense of wonder about the natural world and inspire you as viewers to establish your own personal bond with nature.

Whle we have succeeded in raising dollars to produce California Forever --we now face a final hurdle to raise additional funds for promotion and publicity to bring viewers to the broadcast – and inspire audiences to preserve these storied places for all of us, now and for generations to come.

If no one sees the show we fail.  It’s that simple.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $3,500 to continue to build "buzz" from now until the September 2012 broadcast through screenings, festivals, and DVD replication.

The Impact

Your contributions will help draw people to the broadcast.  People who don't realize the history and legacy of these storied places.  People who didnt' know that Angel Island detained hundreds of Chinese immigrants; that freed slaves succesfully created and lived in a utopian society called Allensworth; that at risk high school students in Los Angeles have a chance to restore and re-wild an urban park and go off to college as a result; that elephant seals were once near extinction, that off road vehicles bring kids into nature, but also risk destroying it ----- and the samples go on and on and on.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some of you cannot contribute financailly, but that does not mean you cannot help!

Please get the word out about the show!  Share this with others.  Ask your friends to like us on Facebook, contribute if they can, tell everyone.  Together, we know we can make this happen!

Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
My name is Ariana.  I have been a lover of Earth and all of it's beauty my whole life.  As a member of the human race I feel like it  is completely my responsibility to help fix the environmental crisis we all have on our hands.  I have been working through a program called WWOOF to learn about sustainable gardening, edible landscaping, small scale farmers rights, permaculture, and to say it most generally - how to exist again in a harmonious way with nature.  I believe it can be done, and it is my mission to be a part of the movement and to help educate those around me.

 My first destination along my journey in mending the Earth was Sustainable Kashi, in Sebastian, Florida.  The picture of the garden above was taken there, and what you see is a mandala garden bed we made.  It is layered 4 feet deep of dead tree logs, branches, straw, compost, bio-char, peat moss, manure, more straw, and lastly seaweed.  One of the major goals of permaculture is to be constantly adding nutrition and organic matter to the soil, to create a sustainable system.  With a little bit of care this garden bed will create organic fruits and vegetables long into the future, feeding the people the way we feed the soil.  The Kashi Community is a spiritual one, centered around a peaceful pond and inviting shrines.  It was the perfect place to start a journey,  and I am so grateful to have been there.  If you want to see what Kashi is doing with their permaculture program, check it out here - https://www.facebook.com/SustainableKashi?fref=ts.  

Without contributors helping pave the way for education in this emerging field, I will not be able to do the work I am capable of.  I am working on farms for free right now, and since these courses are not a part of a standard degree program student loans and financial aid don't apply. Learning bit by bit by way of internship is great but an intense course in Permaculture would open huge doors for me.  

I need this money to complete a course in Permaculture which will give me the ability to get better jobs where I can make more of an impact with my passion and knowledge.  For contributions starting at $50 I will promise an exchange of CSA produce.  I can agree to help market for other businesses and could trade work hours in exchange for donations.  For all donations above $10 a donation of equal amount will be made to a food pantry or shelter, in order to help the community and spead good works. 

You contribution to my campaign does not only help me.  You help the Earth, literally. By means of extending the arms of Permaculture you are literally helping to sustain the very soil that grows all of our food and is the key to further life on this planet. Nature is inexplicably connected and by helping an area in one spot you just as equally help the rest of the world.  It will be a donation that helps EVERYONE.  If my entire goal is not met, the funds will go to the next available course that I can take when funds do allow it.  These goals cannot be voided, only postponed. 

If you cannot donate, your positive energy would be appreciated.  Making a difference on your own is free, and in lieu of donations please consider your own lifestyle and consider where you could make a change.  Please help me raise these funds and share this campaign on your own Facebook and tell your friends of my good intentions, make comments on this page, even visiting my page once or twice a day will help with publicity.  Thank you to those who can contribute financially, or with good energy.  I love you all and hope to see you soon on a better Earth.

If you cannot donate, your positive energy would be appreciated.  Making a difference on your own is free, and in lieu of donations please consider your own lifestyle and consider where you could make a change.  Please help me raise these funds and share this campaign on your own Facebook and tell your friends of my good intentions, make comments on this page, even visiting my page once or twice a day will help with publicity.  Thank you to those who can contribute financially, or with good energy.  I love you all and hope to see you soon on a better Earth.

story:
This is Igor. He can be seen in Lyon, France doing regular things with regular people.




This is also Igor.




You see, Igor is a bit..unusual. For one, he grew up on a sailboat with his family.




He also has a tendency to do unusual things in unusual places.




Some might say he’s reckless. Others think he is extraordinary.




More recently, he’s been trying to sail around the world on a catamaran with his friend Beto. They have already crossed the Pacific..from Chile, South America to Australia.




Now they’re trying to cross the Atlantic on a 3,000 nautical mile journey from Cape Town, South Africa to Rio, Brazil. That is longer than the distance from New York to Los Angeles.




Obviously, Igor is no sissy and he’s going to do it without a motor in his 25-foot catamaran, Picole.




If you think he’s being unreasonable, let us add that he’s sailing without a cabin either. That’s right, just the open seas, open air, Igor and Beto on month-long voyage across the South Atlantic ocean. Might we add that nobody ever done this before?




Why is he doing all this? Well, because he can. Because someone needs to push the boundaries of what is reasonable and what is possible. Also, there’s the matter of promoting a greener planet through clean energy.



So if you’re for pushing boundaries and helping Mother Nature, support Igor and Beto on their expedition. Your contributions will be used for:

  • Payment to the boat architect
  • Payment to the boat builder
  • Manual water maker
  • Food
  • Special Clothing for the Trip
  • Plane tickets
  • Import customs and fees in South Africa



As they say, every dollar counts. And if Igor is lucky enough to raise extra money, he will use it towards his upcoming crossing of the Indian Ocean. So don't forget to contribute and make you sure check out the excellent perks waiting for you on the right side on this page.

Visit capetowntorio.com for find out all about Igor, Beto and their trip! You can also follow the their progress as they embark on and complete their journey.

Merci, obrigado, thank you!

story:
Tree Spiker Tour - a conversation about environmentalism with Mike Roselle. 

Co-founder of Earth First! as well as of Rainforest Action Network, the Ruckus Society, and Climate Ground Zero. Mike has devoted decades of his life to frontline defence of the environment. Mike has been arrested more than 50 times in non-violent direct actions. 
This tour shares his stories of ecological resistance and talks about our obligation to act against the continuing destruction of the fabric of life. 
At this stage the tour aims to take in Sydney, Northern NSW and Hobart, from the end of March 2015.  We would be happy to look at other areas if there is local support.

The Funds

The money raised will directly go to the flights and other costs associated with the tour. Everyone involved is volunteering their time. 

The Aim

The tours aims to not only provide a historical insight into radical direct action, its successes and failures but to inspire all of us to either take non-violent direct action ourselves or support those that do. 

"Youth have very few models of activism that works, and are being taught to do things in order to just look busy. We have to find ways to engage them, and we're not. Perhaps our computers have made it too easy to be an activist. No one wants to risk anything, and until they are willing to put their lives on the line, to first transform themselves, nothing will happen," said Mike Roselle. 

How You Can Help

If you cannot make a financial contribution there is still many other ways to help.  We need assistance with graphic design, accommodation, distribution of flyers and online advertising. So please get in touch if you can help out.

story:
Summary

My name is Jonathan Corey and on March 3rd, 2015, my brother Jeremy, our friend Sean, and I will begin an attempt to thru-hike the Appalachian Trail. The AT, as it is commonly known, meanders over two thousand miles along the ridgelines of the Appalachian mountain range. Beginning at Springer Mountain, Georgia and ending at Mount Katahdin in Maine, the path leads through some of the most pristine wilderness areas on the East Coast.


The trail will lead us across the peak of Clingman's Dome, the third highest mountain east of the Mississippi, through the Great Smoky Mountains, and into the pastured hills of our home state of Virginia's Grayson Highlands, populated with wild ponies. We'll cross the confluence of the Shenandoah and Potomac rivers at Harper's Ferry, a key battleground in the US Civil War, and, as we continue north, the Mason-Dixon line.


From the rocky mountainsides of Pennsylvania the trail will continue to carry us North as we make our way through the forests of New Jersey, within sight of Manhattan, and onward through Connecticut, Massachussetts and Vermont. The White Mountains of New Hampshire will carry us up above treeline into the alpine tundra. The Presidential Range will take us across Mount Washington, which has held the record for the highest wind speed recorded on Earth at 231mph.  


As we continue North into Maine we will cross the boulders of Mahoosuc Notch and ford through mountain streams as we hike into the 100-mile wilderness and finally up the face of Mount Katahdin. Every day, as we move along the historic trail, our job will be simple. Put one foot in front of the other.


How You Can Help

To complete this trek, we need the help of people like you. Money donated will go towards resupplying with food, replacing broken and worn gear, the occassional splendor of an All-You-Can-Eat buffet, as well as any medical or other unforeseen expenses along the way.


By donating to this fund, you will be enabling us to seize a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity that we will always remember. We promise in exchange to shout your praises from the mountaintops, dedicate an entry to you in one of the many shelter registers along the trail, and keep you updated with photographs and a daily log of our hike. Additionally, we would love to invite you to come hike a section with us as we move ever Northward. 

If you don't have money to give, but still want to help, please share this page among your friends and family. If we can get 1000 people to give a simple $5, we will hit our goal.

Thank you.

story:
Quick overview of our project:

Here at Greensburg GreenTown, we are trying to finish an eco-demonstration home called the Meadowlark House. This house will be built to Passive Standards (using 80-90% less energy than a conventional home) with many more sustainable features to boot.  The goal of the Meadowlark is to promote sustainable building strategies as well as small green changes to eco-tourists who visit Greensburg.  Visitors will get free tours of the home and the option to stay in its Bed & Breakfast to experience green living in depth! The project was started with all the funds secured, but an unforeseen circumstance with our primary funding source left GreenTown needing to secure additional funding to complete the home.  We are raising money for siding, exterior doors, windows, and the installation of those items for the home.  Thanks for your interest!

 

Greensburg, KS: Model Green Community

Five years ago, the town of Greensburg, KS was destroyed by a 1.7 mile wide tornado.  Eleven people lost their lives and 95% of the town was destroyed, but in the wake of this tragedy, the resilience of community was apparent.  They decided to stay in Greensburg and rebuild it as a model sustainable community.   While it may seem odd that a green agenda took hold in the traditionally conservative state of Kansas, to the people of Greensburg, sustainable rebuilding just made sense; it conserves resources and saves money. Thus, the nonprofit Greensburg GreenTown was formed.  GreenTown’s mission was to help the people of Greensburg realize their sustainable mission by providing resources for environmentally conscious reconstruction. Sustainable building is key to reducing environmental impact and conserving energy because as of 2011, buildings accounted for 47.8% of US energy consumption as opposed to transportation (28.1%) and industry (23.2%)! In 2011, GreenTown was ready to take the lessons they learned in Greensburg’s “living laboratory” of sustainable building  to help other communities rebuild after disasters. Since its creation in 2007 GreenTown has seen 10,000 visitors from 48 states and 16 countries!


Chain of Eco Homes:

In the wake of the disaster GreenTown conceptualized the Chain of EcoHomes project. This project allows visitors to see sustainable residential reconstruction first hand, without having to intrude on private homeowners. GreenTown’s first EcoHome, the Silo EcoHome, was completed in 2010.  The Silo Home gives visitors an opportunity to see sustainable practices first hand and actually use different technologies. Some of the sustainable features in the Silo Home include: concrete building envelope, round form (for wind resistance), bamboo floors, a green roof (planted with sedum), dual-flush toilets, repurposed furniture, and more.  Visitors also have the option of spending the night in our Bed and Breakfast in the Silo Home to get a fuller experience of sustainable living.
 
The Silo Eco Demonstration Home
 
The second project in the Chain of Eco Homes that GreenTown undertook was construction of the Meadowlark Home.This home adds to the experiential learning opportunity by offering new products and features to explore.  After an intensive selection from 250 designs, the Meadowlark design was picked featuring wooden insulation blocks (popular in Europe, but not yet established in America) and Passive design.  Passive houses are very well-insulated, practically air tight homes, that can use up to 90% less energy than traditional home design.  The house generates heat primarily through passive solar gain (the increase in temperature from solar radiation) and internal gains from people and electrical equipment.  The house stays cool by means of solar shading, window orientation, and an energy recovery ventilator. Passive design is achieved through strategic positioning of the house in relation to the sun, large windows to allow for natural daylight, superinsulation in the walls, roof, and floor, natural ventilation via window placement, and other design considerations.

 
Meadowlark is a naked home facing an impending winter.
 
Construction began on Meadowlark with a clear, bright future with all the funds secured, but an unforeseen turn of events with our primary funding foundation left GreenTown in need of having to raise additional monies in order to complete the house. The foundation, building envelope, and roof of the house are complete, except for windows, doors, and siding.  Please help us reach our $50,000 goal, which would get us windows, doors, and siding, plus installation.  The windows are triple pane with frame insulation, which will keep with passive house standards by maximally conserving energy.  The windows are especially critical to energy conservation because they let in natural light, which lets in heat energy during the winter. This heats the concrete floor, which means the overall heating needs for the home are reduced. Solar shading protects them from doing heating the house during the summer. The doors and siding are critical for the house endure the winter.  All of these items will bring us a big step closer to completing this second eco home.
 
Meadowlark's current state of affairs. 
 
 
Your donation will help us bring sustainable building concepts to the American public.
 
When the house is complete it will be free and open to the public, showing visitors another way to build sustainably!  The system of wood blocks used for the Meadowlark is not used by any other building in America, so the Meadowlark house has already made history.  We just have to finish it.  When visitors experience the sustainable practices we have implemented here in Greensburg, they are inspired to incorporate those practices into their projects.  From the figures in the first section involving energy expenditure, green building has the most potential to cut down our energy consumption in the US.  We have companies who have pledged to donate energy efficient appliances, landscaping, patio, lighting fixtures, and more, but who cannot make these valuable contributions until other aspects of the house are finished. Your contribution will help get the US on the right track to cutting the energy consumption of our buildings down to size by educating our visitors on how we do so.
 
Passive House concepts employed by Meadowlark.
 

Some testimonials from our B&B visitors:

Greensburg and the Silo Home are truly ahead of the curve and I look forward to taking some of the things I learned back to my home and the surrounding areas.
- Tony Germain, Midland, MI

I leave here inspired and replenished...The house is a unique and inspiring home with a truly brilliant vision for the world. And it’s super comfortable!
- Lisa, San Diego, CA

An AWESOME concept and inspiration for making small eco-friendly, sustainable changes to our own homes. Thanks for being the “green” that matters.
- Amity Moore and Ashway Lawver

This house is like a classroom! There’s so much to learn.
- Anna Bagely

My hat is off to you for inspiring us all to do better and to go outside the box in our general thinking. Thank you for inspiring and keep up the good work.
- Leo French, Liberal and Glenn Elder, KS
 
Contact:
Sydney Menees - sydney@greensburggreentown.org
(620) 723-2790

story:
The Story

WE ARE SORRY BUT INDIEGOGO LINKS VIA PAYPAL DO NOT WORK, THEREFORE, YOU CANNOT CONTRIBUTE TO THIS CAMPAIGN. WE HAVE NOT BEEN ABLE TO GET THIS RESOLVED. Conventional agriculture which engages the practices of tilling, chemical fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides, inefficient irrigation and heavy dependence on fossil fuels has resulted in depleted soils and decreased crop yields on an international scale. The introduction of Genetically Modified Organisms (GMO’s) has rapidly accelerated the soil depletion process and produces foods that are depleted of basic nutrients and essential minerals that are necessary for human health.

                     

I am Jeffrey Scott, CEO of Green Village Biofertilizers, llc. I have been working in algae for over nine years and have developed an extraordinary Live Algae Soil Amendment that can make a significant contribution to the regeneration of depleted soils on a global scale. 


What We Need & What You Get

The purpose of this campaign is to complete USDA Organic Certification, independent field trials and to launch a small scale Production Facility. The intention is to provide regional Production Facilities and product globally.

Green Village needs to raise one hundred fifty thousand dollars to evolve to the next stage of production.

Use of Funds:     

Installation and maintenance of production system         $50,000

Organic certification process                                                  $30,000

Implementing field trials                                                          $30,000

Administration                                                                            $40,000

TOTAL                                                                                          $150,000

This will give Green Village the capacity to produce 3000 kilos of USDA Certified Organic soil amendment per month.

If, per chance, we do not meet our goal, our highest priority is to produce product  and obtain Organic Certification.

Gold and Platinum Ambassadors Club                                 Featured Perk

The role of Ambassador is unique and at a grass roots level can be a vehicle to greatly enhance the reach of education and free distribution of product. Seriously dedicated growers that are passionate about organic production and healthy vibrant, foods which have an awareness of what is needed in the future for agriculture will find a place to do something that matters.

What we ask in return is data collection. We want feedback from the individuals or organizations that sample our product with specifics to performance.

Additional benefits of being an Ambassador include: free entry to any events Green Village is  presenting at and attendance of the yearly Ambassadors Gala. An event that gives Green Village the opportunity to thank its supporters.


The Impact

Organic Solution

Organic farming is certainly not new. There is evidence of growing cultures of organic farmers worldwide. Urban gardens, Permaculture organizations, rooftop gardening, farmer’s markets and large scale organic farming reported as thirty-nine billion dollars in 2015, (USDA 2015 report).

What is needed is a wider understanding of the symbiotic relationship between soil and plants and what is essential for healthy plant growth. This means education and easy to use organic soil amendments that are designed to support healthy soil which, in turn, supports excellent plant growth.

This is exactly what the intention Green Village Biofertilizers has with its AlgaeGrow products. With populations on the rise, food and water will be critical for the survival and prosperity of the global community. Please help!

Risks & Challenges

We acknowledge that there are alway risks and challenges that are not apparent in the moment. However, the Team are experienced business men and women. The product works exceptionally well and has been tested in-house. We have third party research that lends validity to our work. The Independent Field Trials will insure validity of our studies. We believe we have done everything possible to reduce risk, the challenge will be to keep up with production as we establish regional production facilities nationally and internationally.

The Green Village Team is confident that we can achieve our funding goal and invite you to take a closer look, Thank you.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute, who do you know?

Not everyone can contribute or become an Ambassador, however, we hope that through our lower level Perks we can put some of our product in you hands and on your gardens. If not, please tell your fellow gardeners and organic farmers about our campaign.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools. Thanks again, Jeffrey

Seriously dedicated growers that are passionate about organic production and healthy vibrant, foods which have an awareness of what is needed in the future for agriculture will find a place to do something that matters. 
What we ask in return is data collection. We want feedback from the individuals or organizations that sample our product with specifics to performance.
Additional benefits of being an Ambassador include: free entry to any events Green Village is  presenting at and attendance of the yearly Ambassadors Gala. An event that gives Green Village the opportunity to thank its supporters.

  The Impact 

Organic Solution

Organic
farming is certainly not new. There is evidence of growing cultures of organic
farmers worldwide. Urban gardens, Permaculture organizations, rooftop gardening,
farmer’s markets and large scale organic farming reported as thirty-nine
billion dollars in 2015, (USDA 2015 report). 
What
is needed is a wider understanding of the symbiotic relationship between soil
and plants and what is essential for healthy plant growth. This means education
and easy to use organic soil amendments that are designed to support healthy
soil which, in turn, supports excellent plant growth. 
This is exactly what the intention Green Village Biofertilizers has with its AlgaeGrow products. With populations on the rise, food and water will be critical for the survival and prosperity of the global community. Please help!
  Risks & Challenges We acknowledge that there are alway risks and challenges that are not apparent in the moment. However, the Team are experienced business men and women. The product works exceptionally well and has been tested in-house. We have third party research that lends validity to our work. The Independent Field Trials will insure validity of our studies. We believe we have done everything possible to reduce risk, the challenge will be to keep up with production as we establish regional production facilities nationally and internationally. 
The Green Village Team is confident that we can achieve our funding goal and invite you to take a closer look, Thank you. 
  Other Ways You Can Help Can't contribute, who do you know?
Not everyone can contribute or become an Ambassador, however, we hope that through our lower level Perks we can put some of our product in you hands and on your gardens. If not, please tell your fellow gardeners and organic farmers about our campaign. 
Please use the Indiegogo share tools. Thanks again, Jeffrey

story:
Short Summary

Cocos Island National Park is world renowned as an exceptional reservoir of biodiversity and endemism, aside from being a site of unmatched scenic beauty. The site was declared UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1997.  The famous marine scientist, diver and nature filmmaker Jacques Yves Cousteu called Cocos Island “the most beautiful island in the world."

Its waters host more than 30 unique marine species found nowhere else on Earth, that represent more than 40% of the total marine endemic species in the world. More than 600 fish species are estimated to live within the boundaries of the protected area, with an average density of 7.8 tons per marine hectare, according to the park. Among the most emblematic species are the giant manta ray, humpback whales, bottlenose dolphins, whale sharks, white point sharks and hammerhead sharks. In fact, the island is also known as “Shark Island” due to their abundance, including the largest schools of hammerhead sharks known in the world. 

The main threat affecting Cocos Island is illegal fishing, both inside and outside the protected area’s boundaries, that seriously alters the delicate marine ecological dynamics of the island by considerably reducing species’ populations that are critical to such balance. This in turn increases the demand for these species, namely tuna, lobster, and shark fins (specially for Asian markets), among others, that lead to the use of low-cost and highly extractive techniques that can supply that demand. 


All Aboard for Cocos Island is a joint initiative between Forever Costa Rica and Friends of Cocos Island (FAICO), two local NGOs, that have joined forces with a local TV channel, Channel 7, a phone operator, Kolbi, and a newspaper company, La Nación, to create a crowd funding  campaign that seeks to raise $200,000 to purchase a speedboat to intercept illegal fishers. The boat will be donated to the National Park System, so that the park guards can operate the boat and help increase control and surveillance in this site. 

For the next two months, donations will be collected via text messages, bank deposits, at supermarkets and at special public collection events.

What we need 

We need to raise $200,000 to purchase a speedboat that has the capacity to intercept illegal fishers. The park guards in the island struggle daily with the task of patrolling the waters, and this boat would improve the park’s capacity to intercept boats within the protected 12 nautical miles. Forever Costa Rica has been working with Conservation International and with the support of the Oceans 5 Foundation to install of a radar in this island, to help track vessels illegally entering the area. The speedboat will help the park guards react immediately to prevent illegal fishing and deter poachers. The funds will also help provide maintenance and repairs for the speedboat. 

The Impact

Few places remain on this earth where we can still see what the oceans were like hundreds of years ago. Cocos Island is one of those places, where abundant marine fauna, especially large predators, have earned this place the label of the "Serengeti of the Seas. " However, recent studies show that the shark population in Cocos is declining rapidly.  We cannot afford to lose this battle against illegal fishing. Please help us protect this wonderful place.

Forever Costa Rica led a similar crowd funding campaign to help protect Palo Verde National Park's wetlands. We raised approximately $300,000 in two months, and have been able to restore the wetlands over the past three years. Now it is your chance to make a difference as well.

Risks and Challenges

While a single speedboat might not be the only solution to preventing illegal fishing in this park, it is part of a larger strategy which includes the installation of a radar, the use of satellite technology, and the creation of more stringent legislation. Every step and every effort counts. By providing cutting edge technology and equipment, we hope to detract poachers from this area. 

Other ways you can help

Please spread the word about this campaign. Help us make some noise for the sharks! Help us protect Cocos Island, forever. Use the Indiegogo tools to spread the word!

story:
I am Calvin Hogue, President and Founder of Musicians for Biodiversity. I first heard the word Biodiversity back in 2010 when the United Nations declared that year as the Year on Biodiversity. As I started to understand what this matter was all about, I was inspired to use the resources that I have to help get the Biodiversity message across to people.

I am the Owner of Lyfe Production, a small multimedia business. I am also a musician and host of the" DrCal Hour of Insight" on BlogTalkRadio.com which gives me access to talented musicians and artists all around the world. Realizing how music can attract people and get their attention, this is what inspired me to partner with the United Nations and to create Musicians for Biodiversity.

OUR MISSION

Our mission is to help educate and inform people about the importance of Biodiversity in an easy to understand format and friendly environment. We believe that if people understand what Biodiversity is and how important it is, it will inspire them to do whatever they can to help stop Biodiversity loss.

How we will carry out our mission

 MFB will be host events in the United States as well as other countries. These events will provide entertainment as well as information about what Biodiversity is and what people can do to help. Events will also include guest speakers from different environmental organizations that will share information on what their organization is doing and how people can get involved.

Focus on Children

Some of these events will focus on children, providing a friendly atmosphere that will engage their attention This is a very important part of our mission because children are our future and it is important to instill in them the importance of Biodiversity. This will help ensure a better future for the generations to come.

Already in Progress

In February of 2012, I began hosting a show on BlogTalkRadio.com called "From the Top" My first guest was David Ainsworth, the program officer for the United Nations Decade on Biodiversity. I have interviewed guests from many different organizations that focus on Biodiversity and other environmental issues. I believe that this show inspires and helps inform people about what is being done, and what they can do to help stop biodiversity loss.

Expenses That Need to Be Covered

Event coordination

Basic technology equipment and maintenance

Audio  and Visual equipment for events

Production of literature and paraphernalia for events

Travel expenses.

Impact

While it would be so easy for all of us just to sit back and say “ let someone else worry about Biodiversity” it is far better to do what we can now. People naturally have the tendency to only worry about their individual bottom line and what seems to be affecting them at the present moment. However this is what leads to major complications in the future. Biodiversity loss is an issue that affects all of us, not just a certain group of people. So we all need to understand the importance of Biodiversity and what we can do to conserve it.

Others ways to help

Share Indiegogo site and tools.

Contact us about hosting an event in your area.

         

                               



Perks

story: I am building a wood splitter with a mechanical assist wood lift for my father. I am also, as a senior in engineering, required to do a "senior Design" project. I have had the idea for a few years but the requirement for a school design project gave me the opportunity to use my idea constructively. There are splitters out there that are similar but in order to graduate all of the design and calculations have been my own with influence from successful products. I grew up splitting wood with him, on a farm where my parents still live, and using wood as heat for the winter but, over 30 years in construction have taken a toll on his back and arms. He is currently recovering from his 3rd rotator cuff surgery and has permanent nerve damage from a bone spur that has left his right hand partially paralyzed. He has always been one of the hardest workers I know and loves being outside but has had to sacrifice some of the things he enjoys because of the surgeries. Every winter I look forward to being outside, cutting and splitting wood with him and he is still able to cut wood, and loves cutting and splitting, but he cannot lift the large chunks of wood or stay in the cold long because of his hand. Seeing him sacrifice time doing what he likes because of this, I decided I was going to build him a splitter that allowed him to use less effort and be more efficient so we could still enjoy splitting and burning wood together.

story:
Join our 2014 year end donation campaign to support our work on behalf of New Mexico's watersheds in 2015! 


Join the NM Watershed Resources Network 2014 year end donation campaign and help support our projects for 2015.  100% of your donations received through this campaign will go directly to bringing new resources, workshops, and project opportunities to a broader audience,  You can help us make a difference, right here in New Mexico.

In 2015, we are also launching our website.  It is designed to make information and resources about the benefits of water harvesting, green infrastructure, sustainable development, and  watershed protection, restoration, and conservation easily accessible to everyone.

Make your donation now by credit card.  You can also make donations online through your Paypal account, and directly via personal check.  Mail to:  PO Box 3028, Corrales, NM 87048
 

NM Watershed Resources Network is a coalition project funded through Earth Futures, a nonprofit 501 (c) 3 tax exempt organization.  All donations to NM Watershed Resources Network and this campaign are income tax deductible.  

For questions and further assistance send an email to: watershedmgnm@earthfutures.us, or call us at 505-433-8273.

Other Ways You Can Help  Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Follow us on Facebook
  • And use the Indiegogo share tools.

Thanks! And that's all there is to it!

story:
African Parks is a non-profit who, along with their government partners, establishes, rehabilitates and manages protected areas in some of Africa’s most challenging places. Established in 2003, African Parks currently protects over 4.1 million hectares in six African countries containing some of Africa’s most remarkable biodiversity, including nearly 400 mammal species, more than 1000 bird species and many thousands of plant species.

Africa is in the midst of a conservation crisis and African Parks is embroiled in an all-out war against wildlife poaching and trafficking. African Parks takes a direct approach to combating wildlife poaching and trafficking by employing and equipping its own law enforcement teams of rapid response rangers on the ground. The opposition is a well-funded, highly trained global wildlife trafficking syndicate whose reach extends far beyond Africa. Wildlife trafficking has also even been linked to terrorist activities and the arming of foreign government troops. African Parks has established an anti-poaching fund to support its anti-poaching rangers on the front line, the boots on the ground collectively walking thousands of kilometres a day in order to protect Africa’s wildlife against this scourge.

In February 2015, African Parks will be sending 14 runners including five Zakouma National Park rapid response rangers, to participate in a half Ultra Marathon (90 kilometers) in the Saharan Desert in Chad. The five rangers of Team Zakouma will run in moral support of all the anti-poaching rangers who dedicate their time, and often their lives, to conservation throughout Africa on a daily basis. In addition, Team African Parks is running in solidarity with Team Zakouma to raise awareness of the African poaching crisis and to solicit support for African Parks’ anti-poaching efforts.

story:
Summary

One of my biggest role models has invited me to join her in Ladakh, India, this summer to help her continue her work of spreading awareness and creating community dialogue about sustainable forms of development for the region. 

In college I was introduced to the work of Helena Norberg Hodge, and went to see her speak at a screening of her film, the Economics of Happiness. I was immensely inspired by her work and the work of the International Society for Ecology and Culture. She summed up beautifully what I felt my life's work was going to be: drawing together the critical reality of globalization, its harmful impacts on ecosystems and communities everywhere, and environmental and social justice in the face of the growing global economy. 

You can read more about ISEC and the Ladakh Project here: http://www.localfutures.org/ladakh-project 

What I Need & What You Get

I am thrilled that ISEC will cover my room and board during my two month stay there, but to go this summer I need to raise enough money for the airfare and some extra back up funds for traveling. Flights cost around $2,000 round trip, not including the travel costs from Delhi to Ladakh. None of the funds will go directly to ISEC, I am only fundraising to get myself there to work with them. 

For contributions, I am making new paintings, prints, and other visually pleasing and fun creations! For a contribution of $36-$99, I'll send you a new small art piece. For $100 or more, I'll send you a larger new art piece. If you contribute $400 or more, I will commission something for you or someone you know - whatever size and medium you would like!

The Impact

Ladakh is one of the most remote regions of India, nestled high in the Himalayas. Helena began work in Ladakh over 30 years ago, and since then has witnessed its rapid globalization and the intense environmental, social, and economic implications. The result has been increasing community and family breakdown, unemployment, sprawling urban slums and pollution. 

Since 1975, ISEC has been working in Ladakh to provide Ladakhis with information about conventional development and its impacts in other regions of the world, as well as creating dialogue around more sustainable patterns of development in Ladakh itself, using local knowledge and resources. 

If I go this summer, I will get to work for an organization whose mission is deeply important to me, as well as experience first hand the conversation around shifting to localized development in Ladakh. I will be directly assisting with and leading programs to  educate western visitors about the harmful and destructive impacts of conventional development that we support simply by being unaware. 

If you choose to support this fundraiser, you will not only help me to do work that is meaningful to me, but you will be supporting the spread of critical knowledge about how we develop and structure our societies in ways that are destructive, and more importantly expanding the dialogue and education of sustainable solutions everywhere.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a position to help at this time, thank you for reading this far anyway! If you can, please spread the word about my fundraising campaign and about the work of ISEC. Go see the Economics of Happiness, and then talk to me about it. 

With love, gratitude, and appreciation,

Sophie

story:
The Black Mamba APU was founded by Transfrontier Africa and was create to protect Olifants West Nature Reserve in Balule starting off with a team of 6, now a little over one year later the Black Mamba APU has grown to cover the entire Balule area and continues to expand. The Black Mamba APU is the first of its kind, being that the majority of our teams are women. 

We operate in an open system and our directly connected to the Kruger National Park. We are therefore custodians of the wild animals that roam freely throughout Balule Private Nature Reserve. The Western Region has been registered with the National and Provincial governments as a component of the national protected areas network. We maintain and protect the western boundary fence of the Greater Kruger National Park, a significant barrier between human-wildlife conflict and poachers entering the protected areas network.

Anti-Poaching is a major need in the area. We are constantly plagued by rhino and bush-meat poachers. Apart from Antelopes other endangered species such as wild dogs and cheetah are also often the victims to snaring. Our dedicated teams are constantly deployed and managed. The Black Mamba APU search and destroy poacher’s camps, wire-snares and bush-meat kitchens every day. Over 1160 Rhinos were poached in South Africa this past year, and we have been able keep our Rhino's safe, having not lost any to poaching in the last 8 months. The Black Mamba’s early detection and rapid response combined with aerial support and specialist dogs is all that stands between wildlife and poachers.

YOUR HELP IS NEEDED TO FUND THE FOLLOWING:

The western boundary fence of the Greater Kruger Park is a critical barrier against human-wildlife conflict and poachers. This fence is under constant attack and requires regular maintenance, day and night patrols and technology to safe-guard the Kruger Park. Remote sensors, camera-traps, vegetation management and rapid response units are required to maintain and secure this boundary. Anti-Poaching Vehicle repairs, maintenance, fuel and tyres. GPS’s, remote GSM cameras, Digital Radios as well as uniforms, rations and equipment are all required to keep the Black Mamba APU operational and allow them to continue protecting the wildlife within the area.

We receive no government help and all costs involved to keep the Black Mamba APU operational is funded by Non-profit organisations and individuals like yourselves.

Any contribution you can afford will go straight to The Black Mamba Anti-Poaching Unit and supply our women with food, uniforms, equipment, vehicles and fuel, allowing us to continue protecting the wildlife that roams freely throughout the reserve.

HELP US TO STOP THE SLAUGHTER!!
story_txt:
The Black Mamba APU was founded by Transfrontier Africa
and was create to protect Olifants West Nature Reserve in Balule starting off
with a team of 6, now a little over one year later the Black Mamba APU has
grown to cover the entire Balule area and continues to expand. The Black Mamba
APU is the first of its kind, being that the majority of our teams are
women. 
We operate in an open system and our directly connected to
the Kruger National Park. We are therefore custodians of the wild animals that
roam freely throughout Balule Private Nature Reserve. The Western Region has
been registered with the National and Provincial governments as a component of
the national protected areas network. We maintain and protect the western
boundary fence of the Greater Kruger National Park, a significant barrier
between human-wildlife conflict and poachers entering the protected areas
network.

Anti-Poaching is a major need in the area. We are constantly plagued by rhino and
bush-meat poachers. Apart from Antelopes other endangered species such as wild
dogs and cheetah are also often the victims to snaring. Our dedicated teams are
constantly deployed and managed. The Black Mamba APU search and destroy
poacher’s camps, wire-snares and bush-meat kitchens every day. Over 1160 Rhinos were poached in South
Africa this past year, and we have been able keep our Rhino's safe, having not
lost any to poaching in the last 8 months. The Black Mamba’s early detection
and rapid response combined with aerial
support and specialist dogs is all that stands between wildlife and poachers. 
YOUR HELP IS NEEDED TO FUND
THE FOLLOWING:
The western boundary fence of the Greater Kruger Park is
a critical barrier against human-wildlife conflict and poachers. This fence is
under constant attack and requires regular maintenance, day and night patrols
and technology to safe-guard the Kruger Park. Remote sensors, camera-traps,
vegetation management and rapid response units are required to maintain and
secure this boundary. Anti-Poaching Vehicle repairs, maintenance, fuel and
tyres. GPS’s, remote GSM cameras, Digital Radios as well as uniforms, rations
and equipment are all required to keep the Black Mamba APU operational and
allow them to continue protecting the wildlife within the area.
We receive no government help and all costs involved to
keep the Black Mamba APU operational is funded by Non-profit organisations and individuals
like yourselves.
Any contribution you can afford will go straight to The Black Mamba
Anti-Poaching Unit and supply our women with food, uniforms, equipment, vehicles
and fuel, allowing us to continue protecting the wildlife that roams freely
throughout the reserve.
HELP US TO STOP THE SLAUGHTER!!

story:
The Story

When we were faced with the question of how to press our debut record, we wanted to do something smarter than CDs. Vinyls are out of our budget, and we were forced to question the practicality of a utility like a CD or vinyl, that are wonderful and romantic to own, but are no longer used as much as digital devices to listen to music. 

As a design student approaching graduation at MassArt in May, I have to complete a research project for my degree. The focus of my semester long project is finding an alternative form to release a full length record, utilizing digital technologies used for listening to music today, but avoiding the harmful impact of PVC plastic, poly-wrap, paper, and CMYK printing that are used in the creation of CD's and vinyl records. 

To avoid the environmental impact of duplicating hundreds of units made of PVC plastic, we are going to be releasing the worlds very first BLP (Balsa LP) A 12"x12" inch unique, screen printed and numbered piece artwork that will accompany a digital download of our full length record. 

Why balsa wood? 

Environmental Impact:

Balsa wood comes from a type of tree that is actually classified as a weed, meaning it grows wildly without forced aggregation. The trees themselves can reach a full maturity in as little as 4 - 6 years, and can grow up to 100 feet, making it an extremely sustainable building material.  

Tangible Practicality:

Balsa wood is most commonly used for model plane building, mainly because it is very easily shapeable into any desired shape. ie. 12"x12" inch, the overly romantic size of a vinyl record sleeve. (yum!) 

Economically:

Unfortunately, most plastics used for CD making are imported from China. Low cost, quick and dirty 10 cent pieces of Dioxin coming half way across the planet to sit on the shelves of music fans everywhere while we don't use them to actually listen to the music.  

Balsa wood grows rapidly in several parts of the good old U.S of A, Central and South America. Which means when we place our order, we'll be ordering an American product from an independent American business. 

What we need $ for:

  • 250 Sheets of beautiful Balsa
  • Eco-safe Screen printing Ink + Screen Materials
  • Eco-friendly Tote bags (to carry the release in the night of the big event!)
  • V-Neck Shirts
  • Crop Top shirts (for the ladies)
 

Final Note:

For all these reasons above, we ask you to help us fund this project and make this possible. We've never been so damn excited to release a piece of music in our lives, so your pledge will forever hold a piece of our black, yellow (and now green) hearts. Thanks! ( :

- The Devil's Twins 

 

We do Most of our updates on The Devil's Twins Facebook 

Videos + More Goodies!

Preview the Album!

Record Release Event Trailer

The Devil's Twins Live From Club Midway

story:
Press Release http://www.iluvmyplanet.com/press.html

iLuvMyPlanet! - Inspiration for Change
Come take a test drive at http://www.iluvmyplanet.com

 

"Great Change for Earth starts small from inside your Heart. Let it shine through in every thing you do"

Support a Thriving Global Community that Cares about our Planet Earth!  

"By contributing to iLuvMyPlanet you will be supporting all the passionate visionaries, artists, professionals, sustainable business and great non-profits working hard to save the planet."

We have the technology to preserve our collective intelligence, hopes, aspirations, dreams, and most of all our HEART. If each single person on Earth contributed one small action from there Heart it would add up to immeasurable ways..

The Global Impact

The impact of this project is huge. Imagine harnessing the collective and creative intelligence of the entire planet. Each new member that joins and contributes to the platform means that everyone in the community will benefit. We will have a place to come to for inspiration, compassion, knowledge, wisdom, and most important Love. Love is the language that all species understand and can relate to. 

IF you LOVE and Care for our Planet Earth, please fund us! Imagine if each person on Earth donated something positive, it will add up and really make a huge difference.

Every dollar counts! Help us by spreading the word. Retweet on Twitter or share on Facebook. That alone is enough to push this great endeavor along. 


What Are We Doing with the Funds?

We intend to raise funds to get office space, hire a team of developers to build out the rest of the iLuvMyPlanet Platform and also develop Android/IOS Apps as well.

 

What is the Current State of iLuvMyPlanet?

We have over 400 members consisting of Artists, Professionals, Green Biz and Non Profits.

We also have global citizens as well. Types of content we have. Articles, Poems, Art, Music, Films, Photography. Also a directory of green businesses.

1200 followers of Twitter

4,999 friends on Facebook

3,000+ professional connections on LinkedIn

 

Why is membership not free?

We only want members that we can verify. The best way is to put up a subscription pay wall. This way you can be sure that every member on our platform is a real person. $10 per year comes out to be less than $1 dollar a month. We also use this to continually upgrade and maintain our platform to the highest degree of love and care.

 

An inspirational gift from us to you!

We decided to make the inspirational poem available to everyone.

I Luv My Planet - a poem written by our coFounder Tanya von Zychlinsky

http://iluvmyplanet.com/poetry/iluvmyplanet.html

If this has inspired you and touches your heart, why not come support the ones who keep sharing inspiration to make our world just that little bit more beautiful. There are no limitations in sharing from the heart – and everyone counts. If you loved this, there is more where this came from. Welcome to iLuvMyPlanet!

Update! Tanya our ever creative and inspiring coFounder has decided to offer her majestic giclée of the mEternity painting as one of the perks!


What is iLuvMyPlanet?

iLuvMyPlanet! is a Purpose Driven Social Media Platform built around "Inspiration for Change." We are a global social media platform for empowered citizens, visionaries, artists, experts, non-profit organizations and eco-friendly companies.

iLuvMyPlanet! is open to anyone on Planet Earth; Empowered Citizens, Change Agents, Visionaries, Filmmakers, Photographers, Artists, Musicians, Inventors, Explorers, Environmentalists, Animal Lovers, Nature Lovers, Writers, Eco-Friendly Businesses and Great Non Profits.

Along with his biz partner Mel, a prolific producer in Hollywood, and Tanya von Zychlinsky, coFounder, passionate visionary guide, clairvoyant creator and evolutionary leader, they plan to build a great company to serve an ever greater need: Saving The Planet.


iLuvMyPlanet! is a Sustainable Organic Ecosystem built for social change. Imagine a social network + user generated content (videos, articles, pictures, art, products) + Professional Content Publishing Platform + E-Commerce. Members can join groups led by experts, share multimedia content and connect with others. Experts can publish articles, share content, and connect with members from all over the Planet. Eco Publishers can promote e-books, stream documentaries, showcase films. Green businesses can promote and sell products to our community. Non-Profits communicate and connect with our audience.

Team

Twizz D. Ha, Founder/President/CEO

Twizz has over 15 years experience as a creative new media entrepreneur in Silicon Valley. He loves the outdoors and being with nature. Twizz has great respect for the environment, the ocean, and the different plants and animals that thrive on planet Earth. 

Tanya von Zychlinsky - CoFounder  

Tanya is a passionate visionary spiritual teacher connecting people with their passions. As clairvoyant creative and evolutionary leader she brings advanced information and radical transformation loaded with love. She is an advanced healer to healers, evolutionary leaders, creative spiritual entrepreneurs and conscious visionary entertainers - artists, performers - who are already successful and thriving in their field, as well as those who are ready to.

Melvin Wilmirth, Vice President 

Mel has over 20 years experience as a film movie producer, he is currently at Sunset Gower Studios in Hollywood.Mr. Willmirth teamed up with Internationally Best Selling Author, Marc Fisher. They created Turning Point Pictures together. Mr. Willmirth has written 11 screenplays/teleplays in his lifetime and just signed a producing deal with EMO Films. Mr. Willmirth has worked in film finance including setting up gap financing for the film, Cadillac Records and other projects. His recent efforts have landed a client’s body of literary works with Dreamworks for consideration for a multi-picture deal. He has also created a television series that is in development with major executives.

 

The iLuvMyPlanet Story

"Earth is spiraling out of control, we are destroying our planet, our future is at stake. Our entire survival as a species is in jeopardy. We must correct our past mistakes, re-discover our spiritual roots and re-invigorate the Great Thinkers of tommorrow. The industrial age has left the planet sick. We need to make things better" Twizz D. Ha - Founder/CEO

“Twizz, a creative artist/entrepreneur in Silicon Valley wanted to use his expertise of building tech startups to do something that would make a positive difference in the world. So he turned his attention to saving the planet.”

The idea for "iLuvMyPlanet! - The First Purpose Driven Social Network" came to Twizz while he was working on his boat engine at Pier 39, San Francisco. He got frustrated because there was all kinds of oil and sludge that came out. He knew that this gunk would eventually pollute the ocean and our atmosphere. From that moment he realized that something had to be done to change the mindset of the world. So he did some soul searching, looked back to his childhood. He remembered playing on hillsides along small creeks, being outdoors, exploring beaches and parks. Twizz knew that he had a deep love and respect for nature, the ocean, different plants and animals. He started spending more time in the garden, growing vegetables, planting trees and connecting with nature on a deeper level. His eating habits also changed, along with a regular exercise regimen at the local gym, he even got some old bikes to fix up from local yard sales. Each Saturday morning was a trip to the local farmers market for fresh fruits and vegetables.

From this great spiritual awakening the "Inspiration for iLuvMyPlanet!” came. “It was so simple and natural how it came to me.” says Twizz.

Two events that he attended would inspire him to take action. One was the TED Silicon Valley event at Stanford called "Innovation for Social Change." There were all these great thinkers, talented artists and inspirational speakers at the event on stage talking about social change. The event truly inspired him to do something great for the planet. The other was the San Francisco Green Festival that he attended with his friends. "It was great to be able to see this huge movement that was happening. All the vendors, the great food and the music was amazing!"

Since Jan 2010 after receiving some seed funding from a close friend, along with his own time and money, he was off to the races. After many months of dedication, perseverance and working on the project till late nights. All while juggling day to day work from his design studio, ten months later on 10.10.10, the site was launched to the public.

He hopes that each new member can go thru the same spiritual awakening as he did and reconnect with nature, the planet and the global community. They can change their lifestyle, live a healthier and more spiritual life. "We must correct our past mistakes, re-discover our spiritual roots and re-invigorate the Great Thinkers of tomorrow. The industrial age has left Planet Earth sick, we need to make things better" says Twizz.

The site is open to anyone on Planet Earth; Empowered Citizens, Change Agents, Visionaries, Filmmakers, Photographers, Artists, Musicians, Inventors, Explorers, Environmentalists, Animal Lovers, Nature Lovers, Writers, Eco-Friendly Businesses and Great Non Profits. "The company will actively promote all the members, artists, professionals and green companies along with all the great non profits that are working hard to save the planet." Along with his biz partner Mel, a prolific producer in Hollywood, and Tanya von Zychlinsky, coFounder, passionate visionary guide, clairvoyant creator and evolutionary leader, they plan to build a great company to serve an ever greater need: Saving The Planet.
