story:
Our Story

Hey there!  We're blissmo, and we help you discover products that are safer, healthier & better for you and your planet. There are sooo many bath, food and cleaning products out there making soo many claims – and I think we all just want safe, healthy & effective products, right? That’s why we’re here – to help you 'discover what's better' ;)

 

Why?  At blissmo, we believe that if we can introduce you to better products – think brands like method, PACT, and Numi Tea – you'll wonder why you ever bought the other stuff in the first place.  And if together enough of us buy products with fewer or (no!) toxins that are sourced, made and delivered in ways that conserve precious natural resources, the big brands will notice and give us better products that respect our bodies and planet. 


Who We Are

A small team of friends, entrepreneurs, engineers, and nature enthusiasts (working in a cozy San Francisco office) who are dedicated to making the world a better place.  Watch the video and see more on us below. 

 

What We Need

With your help, we can raise $10,000 to spread the word about blissmo, an amazing company we truly believe in.  One that we hope will help everyday consumers like you find the best in organic and sustainable products—so that, together, we can live a happy, healthy life. 

 

How We'll Spend It

- Create an amazing and compelling commercial ad to submit on TED's ads worth spreading contest!

- Film Equipment, transport, rental and insurance

- Hire additional film editor

- Professional post production sound mixing 

- Boxes, envelopes, and stamps to mail you cool stuff!

- Give team members enough money to ship some of our perks to you (and maybe have a donut ;)
 

Other Ways You Can Help

- Spread the word about our campaign!  Hit the share button.

- Join our mailing list to stay up to date on what’s happening with us and what cool products we’re discovering.

- Check out our website for the latest promotions.

- Sign up for a monthly blissmobox, delivered right to your door! Visit: blissmobox.com

- Follow us on Twitter, Facebook, and our blog!  AND re-tweet, re-post, and share!


More on the team below. Thanks for visiting! (and sharing!) (and donating!)

 

Sundeep Ahuja, founder (aka the head honcho)
Why I blissmo: Every dollar we spend is a vote in support of the way a product or service is sourced, produced & delivered. I blissmo because I’m excited to shift the way we spend our dollars towards more sustainable businesses, products & services for a healthier & happier people & planet. Plus, I enjoy discovering organic & eco-friendly products 


Ian Johnstone, co-founder (aka the bank - he keeps us honest)
Why I blissmo: I believe that it matters how responsibly we live, whether we’re deciding how to operate a business or picking a spot for dinner. I blissmo because it makes it easy for consumers to make the right decisions, while providing support to businesses that are doing the right thing.

 

Brett Greenbaum, marketing guru (aka the genius, or just smarty pants)
Why I blissmo: I blissmo because I believe that sustainable living can be both affordable and fun, and blissmo helps prove that to the world. I also think that sustainable businesses provide a powerful solution to our world’s most pressing social and environmental problems; global issues such as climate change and pollution require a shift in the way that business is done and in the way that we consume.

 

Andrew Macnider, customer happiness (aka the lady's man)

Why I blissmo: Waste not; want not. I blissmo because the products and brands featured share my values in taking an active effort at being kinder to our world. Whether it’s the recycled materials, solar powered facilities, organic ingredients, or minimal packaging – I know what I am buying will be better our planet. Supporting these brands functions as an influencer; it’s my hope that all businesses aspire to act with the same intelligent mannerisms.

 

Lily Ho, blissmobox specialist (aka the boss lady - she keeps us in line)
Why I blissmo: Shopping healthier, safer, and sustainably doesn’t mean sacrifice. Oftentimes, it means improvement of products. If we can influence consumer demands in North America, we can make a big impact to improve the global economy and environment.

 

Adam Starr, content (aka the comedian - he makes us snort)
Why I blissmo: I’ve always had a strong pro-bliss stance and was briefly a lobbyist for bliss in the late 80s. Besides that, I blissmo because I love supporting artisans over autocrats, farmers over factories, and artists over accountants.


Nicole Harris, blissmo buff

Why I blissmo: I blissmo because it's healthier for me and my planet, because it's the right thing to do, because it makes me feel good about my lifestyle choices. I know there are tons of ways to live eco-friendly every day, ways that are easier, better and more fulfilling than the traditional routes. if I can make green decisions while simultaneously enjoying fantastic products, than I'm a happy blissmo-er :)


Anh Duong, social media (aka the karaoke queen, self-named)

Why I blissmo: I want to make sure my nephews and nieces grow up in a safe world, full of abundant trees and healthy products, where they don’t have to worry so much about cancer, diabetes, and everything we’re worried about.  I blissmo because I love those kiddos, but I also love finding delicious snacks that are actually healthy – and I hope you do too!


Vanitha Sivarajan, non-profit outreach
Why I blissmo: As a lover of people, cultures, and landscapes, I have always believed that we should feel connected to everything we do and buy. Often, the person or story behind the products we buy is not always in our consciousness. I blissmo because I am excited to show consumers how powerful buying good is in building sustainable communities globally–it not only helps our planet, families, friends, and wallet, but it also connects us to the actual person and story behind the product.
story_txt:
Our Story
Hey
there!  We're blissmo, and we help you discover products that are safer, healthier & better for you and
your planet. There are sooo many bath, food and cleaning products out there making
soo many claims – and I think we all just want safe, healthy & effective products, right? That’s why we’re here – to help you 'discover
what's better' ;)
 
Why?  At blissmo, we believe that if we can
introduce you to better products – think brands like method, PACT, and Numi Tea
– you'll wonder why you ever bought the other stuff in the first place.  And if together enough
of us buy products with fewer or (no!) toxins that are sourced, made and delivered
in ways that conserve precious natural resources, the big brands will notice
and give us better products that respect our bodies and planet. 
 Who We
Are
A small
team of friends, entrepreneurs, engineers, and nature enthusiasts (working in a
cozy San Francisco office) who are dedicated to making the world a better
place.  Watch the video and see more on us below. 
 
What We Need 
With your help, we can raise $10,000 to spread the word about
blissmo, an amazing company we truly believe in.  One that we hope will
help everyday consumers like you find the best in organic and sustainable
products—so that, together, we can live a happy, healthy life.  
 
How We'll Spend It
- Create
an amazing and compelling commercial ad to submit on TED's ads worth spreading
contest!
- Film Equipment, transport, rental and
insurance
- Hire additional film editor 
- Professional post production sound mixing 
- Boxes, envelopes, and stamps to mail you cool stuff!
- Give team members enough money to ship some
of our perks to you (and maybe have a donut ;)
 
Other Ways You Can Help
- Spread
the word about our campaign!  Hit the share button.
- Join our mailing list to
stay up to date on what’s happening with us and what cool products we’re
discovering.
- Check
out our website for the latest promotions.
- Sign up
for a monthly blissmobox, delivered right to your door! Visit: blissmobox.com
- Follow
us on Twitter, Facebook, and our blog!  AND re-tweet, re-post, and share!

More on the team below. Thanks for visiting! (and sharing!) (and donating!)

 
Sundeep Ahuja, founder (aka the head honcho)Why I blissmo: Every dollar we spend is a vote in support of the way a product or service is sourced, produced & delivered. I blissmo because I’m excited to shift the way we spend our dollars towards more sustainable businesses, products & services for a healthier & happier people & planet. Plus, I enjoy discovering organic & eco-friendly products 

Ian Johnstone, co-founder (aka the bank - he keeps us honest)Why I blissmo: I believe that it matters how responsibly we live, whether we’re deciding how to operate a business or picking a spot for dinner. I blissmo because it makes it easy for consumers to make the right decisions, while providing support to businesses that are doing the right thing.
 
Brett Greenbaum, marketing guru (aka the genius, or just smarty pants)Why I blissmo: I blissmo because I believe that sustainable living can be both affordable and fun, and blissmo helps prove that to the world. I also think that sustainable businesses provide a powerful solution to our world’s most pressing social and environmental problems; global issues such as climate change and pollution require a shift in the way that business is done and in the way that we consume.
 
Andrew Macnider, customer happiness (aka the lady's man)
Why I blissmo: Waste not; want not. I blissmo because the products and brands featured share my values in taking an active effort at being kinder to our world. Whether it’s the recycled materials, solar powered facilities, organic ingredients, or minimal packaging – I know what I am buying will be better our planet. Supporting these brands functions as an influencer; it’s my hope that all businesses aspire to act with the same intelligent mannerisms.
 
Lily Ho, blissmobox specialist (aka the boss lady - she keeps us in line)Why I blissmo: Shopping healthier, safer, and sustainably doesn’t mean sacrifice. Oftentimes, it means improvement of products. If we can influence consumer demands in North America, we can make a big impact to improve the global economy and environment.
 
Adam Starr, content (aka the comedian - he makes us snort)Why I blissmo: I’ve always had a strong pro-bliss stance and was briefly a lobbyist for bliss in the late 80s. Besides that, I blissmo because I love supporting artisans over autocrats, farmers over factories, and artists over accountants.

Nicole Harris, blissmo buff
Why I blissmo: I blissmo because it's healthier for me and my 
planet, because it's the right thing to do, because it makes me feel 
good about my lifestyle choices. I know there are tons of ways to live 
eco-friendly every day, ways that are easier, better and more fulfilling
 than the traditional routes. if I can make green decisions while 
simultaneously enjoying fantastic products, than I'm a happy blissmo-er 
:)

Anh Duong, social media (aka the karaoke queen, self-named)
Why I blissmo: I want to make sure my nephews and nieces grow up in a safe world, full of abundant trees and healthy products, where they don’t have to worry so much about cancer, diabetes, and everything we’re worried about.  I blissmo because I love those kiddos, but I also love finding delicious snacks that are actually healthy – and I hope you do too!
Vanitha Sivarajan, non-profit outreachWhy I blissmo: As a lover of people, cultures, and landscapes, I have always believed that we should feel connected to everything we do and buy. Often, the person or story behind the products we buy is not always in our consciousness. I blissmo because I am excited to show consumers how powerful buying good is in building sustainable communities globally–it not only helps our planet, families, friends, and wallet, but it also connects us to the actual person and story behind the product.

story:
(Watch the english trailer here, please: http://youtu.be/x_UPEFoAIVw )

Cocreate - Float - Share

Asap island is the vision of an autarkic sustainable floating island, out of recycled and renewable materials. It is low-tech, low-budget and open source, to help the people in flood-affected areas worldwide to raise their climate change resilience. It also serves as a global floating makerspace for open maritime innovations. Got it? A little open island for a better world.

Started by the german street artist Joy Lohmann in the year 2000, the vision has meanwhile developed into a global community of makers, an artventurous concept and a feasible plan, how to realize it  a.s.a.p. 

THE GOOD NEWS: the construction of the "as-soon-as-possible island" is to be started in early 2014 within a 6-week workcamp in Goa/India. The location and riverside is set from our indian team, 4 workshops will be held by experts from 3 continents and I bet, the glocal participants will deeply enjoy to get it done.

We love to invite you to join asap-island, to share your skills and knowledge online or on location. Please help to make it real with us by crowdfunding or spreading asap-island.

With your help, asap-island will become an open-source pilot island, a floating classroom and stage, a "social sculpture" art project, a venue and symbol for our caring/sharing community.

What We Need & What You Get

We have already organized most of the needs and conditions through our indian team and we´re all volunteering on this. But we now need some money to cover expenses for materials, transports and the documentation of it all, to share our open island with you and the world. (We hope, you´ll visite it once.)

We need 3000,- € for materials (bamboo, cement, few electronics, tools, other stuff); another 2000,- € for transportation and logistics (trash collection, vehicle rent, communication); 2000,- € to share the island with the world (documentation, open-source manuals, public relations, media) and 1000,- €  for this campaign (commissions and production of your invaluable perks).

This is calculated for the minimal island size and configuration. We hope to reach this goal to start asap-island now on professional level. We can also handle more funding, to go far beyond expectations :-)

Your contribution will be rewarded on different levels: 1. Every backer is heartily invited to join the workshops on/offline and will get an original asap-island certificate from India. 2. You can get an asap-island fan-shirt, DVD, book and the first-time complete DIY-island manual. 3. You are part of an open, cocreative community of positive people and hands-on changemakers. 4. You become certified co-owner of a floating island in lovely Goa :-) Every € and $ is needed.

And it´s not alone the money, that counts: Asap-island grows through "social-capital". Let´s share our knowledge and passion, our dreams and efforts, our skills and ideas to create something unique and brilliant together. 

Glocal Impact

A man-made floating island out of trash is a very powerful symbol, inspiring many people and make them feel, think and act differently. 

The project tests and shares the state-of-the-art of open-source lowtech island-design to be copied and improved glocally.

We have prepared an online-platform to coordinate this and other cocreations for humanity and we strongly believe in the power and impact of a cooperating caring/sharing community to be the change we want to see. (For more details on this part, see www.sealand-multiversity.org )

Check out some former floating projects. 2000: future-raft , 2002: Tour21, 2009: future-islands, 2012: i-land Goa, 2013: riverboat SALY or visit our website, facebook group or the asap-island forum.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We´ve mentioned it before, our joint social capital counts!!! If you like asap-island, share it with likeminded people, tell your friends about it, post it in your blogs and networks and get the word out to the world.
  • If you want to get really into it, you´re mostly welcome to become a global future-scout, an asap-island ambassador or a real cocreator at the workcamp in India. (Please contact for further details.)
  • The first step and easiest way is to use the Indiegogo share tools! Of course, you´re absolutely free to interact however...

Thank you for your efforts. Welcome aboard.

The first step and easiest way is to use the Indiegogo share tools! Of course, you´re absolutely free to interact however...


Thank you for your efforts. Welcome aboard.

story:
WATER CREED:  Give Thanks for Water, and Water will speak to you in heretofore forgotten ways "Drink Your Water, Count Your Blessings!"

GREAT-GRANDMOTHERS FOR THE WATERS
 because oil wars should be the last wars ~ (Thank You to Cirque du Soleil for helping make onedrop.org mainstream);

OneDrop.org: "Our movement dreams of a day when the people of the world unite to form a powerful river, sharing wealth of all kinds to protect our water and make certain everyone has access to it. ONE DROP believes global solidarity is the key to our dream of water for all, today and tomorrow."
 

And Now.. from the Old County; They Are Coming!!;

You have to believe in 'What The Bleep'/something(!) when magic happens; This Campaign already has rallied heretofore unimagined resources (anonymous and known donors ~ Thank You Thank You! ~ Plus; rent suddenly halved temporarily out of the blue), ensuring clear passage to bring Great-Grandmother Catherine Browning McFarlane, from the British Isles to California to join 1000 Hummingbirds 'All Nations All Women' 2012 Spring convergence prayer-to-action for the Waters of the Earth.

Still, funds will continue to go towards air fares plus, $540 + $300 shipping, to purchase tipi poles for the tipi skin (Gifted) for dwelling at Hummingbirds (from Nomadics Tipi Makers in Oregon).
 

"I waited and watched where the shadows hung,
I knew for a 1000 years you would come,
And the memory's long of the stone woman,
The roots run deep in the greenwood man.."
(Carolyn Hillyer, Songs of the Forgotten People,
Seventh Wave Music, Dartmoor, UK)

"Just close your eyes and you'll see it,
Just cross the bridge and it's there,
Open your heart that's the dangerous part
The other world's there if you dare.." 
{Julia Cameron, excerpt from her 'Avalon' song} 

This was a surge; a sudden surge of the Possible.The possibility that our elder; our Mum (85) Catherine Browning McFarlane, with two daughter chaperones (Maggi Moon & Heather), could be spirited from the Isles to California Central Coast for this special encounter with elders and youth of far-flung Nations hosted by 1000 Hummingbirds Women's Council, a Native/Non-Native collaborative council for the waters of the earth.
 

"We're a River of birds in migration,
A Nation
Of women with wings.." 

  

Seven years ago I set off from Wounded Knee, SD, sent on my way by Lakota with spirit food for my family in Scotland. Back in the old country, we marked the occasion by building our own stone circle, akin to the Ancients. My mother, Catherine/"wee Cathie", acknowledged the magnitude of the gift; "..Thank You for completing the circle and bringing the blessing home." 

"If I die," he whispered in the dark,"dinna follow me.
The bairns will need ye. Stay for them. I can wait" 
{Outlander}

From the Scottish Highlands to New Zealand to Wounded Knee to the California Central Coast, we trace the trails of our Ancestors, even as we acknowledge that we may never know each lineage thread from whence we hail. We have heard the prayer flute of Gentle Thunder, Song to the  'Unknown Ancestors'. We all live with unknown Ancestors as well as Known.

"I greet the Source,
I honour the ancestors.
I walk in the light.
I embrace life.
I know my wairua is of the stars and returns
to the stars from whence it came" 
Song of the Stone, The Waitaha {Barry Brailsford, New Zealand scribe}

Now here we have the opportunity to bring our mother to the so-called 'New World' for a soul purpose. We are water beings and this is a water planet. Women & girls of hummingbird heart are dreaming anew; many rivers, one source, weaving a world that works for everyone; All Our Relations.


"Another world is not only possible, she's on her way. On a quiet day I can hear her breathing." Arundhati Roy

"A world without bees, a world without hummingbirds
the Village agrees would be wholly absurd
There's nectar a-plenty and flowers dance on the breeze
then let us envision from what has occurred

The value of water we once clearly failed to see
did not esteem soil, nor valued the honey bee
yet joy'd in the hummingbird, delight in spring blossom tree
then let us envision from what has occurred.

From deep in our psyche the age-old canary sings
Lord of Life Cycle Rings, ominous news it bring
The clarion call comes from bees on the brink inklings
then let us envision from what has occurred..."
excerpt from 'World Without Bees' song, CCR McF.

YouTube: 'Sacred Song'; Maggi Moon sings

Hummingbird Herstory - The 1000 Hummingbird Council was formed in Ohlone territory; the San Francisco Bay Area in the Central Coast region of California. The mandate of the Council is explicit: CLEAN WATER and well-being for all; no exceptions; {“All OurRelations”} Hummingbird website link below - 1000Hummingbirds.concarino.org

 "If ever the world sees a time when women shall come together 
purely and simply for the benefit of (hu)mankind, 
it will be a power such as the world has never known." - 
Matthew Arnold, Briitish poet and philosopher (1822-1888) 

Maggi says: if you have questions about the epic Journey of a Clan; Please Ask!!! AND; should funds exceed.. there is another who will fly ;)

FOR: Catherine Browning McFarlane 'My Great Life Story', see "Life Story" Campaign link below - Mum was born in a Mission Hall in London Docklands, of Scottish parents, Scots-Irish descent. Some of her brightest memories are as a small child fascinated and delighted by the (kindly to children) stream of strangers of every color and creed who were coming off the boats during the Great Depression years (and into the Mission for a life-saving hot cup of tea!). From these formative years came her "All People Everywhere"; are the same and need and deserve the same common courtesies and the same protections and rights.

story:
עזרו לנו להגן על חוף זבולון ולמנוע מהעירייה לבנות טיילת מבטון שתגרום לסחיפת החול ולנזק בלתי הפיך לחוף. מעל 6,000 איש חתמו על העצומה ועוד 4,000 חברים הביעו תמיכה בפייסבוק. עלינו לפעול לפני חידוש העבודות בחוף. עזרו לנו ככל יכולתכם, שמרו על קשר והתעדכנו בדף הפייסבוק.

כשבונים קירות או מבנים מבטון בחוף הדבר גורם לגריפת החול על ידי הים, החוף נעלם ונשארת רק מדרכה. בחוף דדו בחיפה, בנהריה, בחוף השרון ובחוף הנפרד בהרצליה זה כבר קרה, חוף סידני עלי נהרס כולו ועכשיו העיריה רוצה לעשות את זה גם בחוף זבולון. טיילת שלב א' נבנתה במקום שיש שוברי גלים והחוף רחב. בזבולון החוף צר מאוד והנזק יהיה בלתי הפיך.

אנחנו דורשים לביטול היתר הבניה והתחלת הליך תכנוני בשיתוף הציבור תוך הצגת חלופות לבניה שלא תפגע בחוף.  תוכנית חדשה צריכה לעבור את כל הערוצים והוועדות הרלוונטיות, להתאים לרוחב החוף, ולהיבנות בצורה שתקטין את הנזק העתידי לסביבה.

מטה המאבק לשמירה על חופי הרצליה מנהל מאבק לעצירת העבודות בחוף זבולון עד שימצא פתרון שלא יגרום נזק סביבתי בלתי הפיך. דעת הציבור לא נשמע בהליך מסודר ובוועדות המתאימות. אנו המנהלים את המאבק זקוקים מידית לכסף בכדי לנהל מאבק משפטי וציבורי מול עיריית הרצליה לעצירה מיידית של עבודות בניית הטיילת שעולה כ 16 מליון ש"ח לתושבי הרצליה. 

אנו מגישים עתירה מנהלית לבית המשפט המחוזי וזקוקים לכ 80,000 ש"ח בהוצאות משפטיות. 

אנו בעד הנגשת החוף לכלל הציבור אך חשוב להבין שבניגוד לטיילת הדרומית ליד המרינה, חוף דבוש וחוף זבולון אינם מוגנים ע”י שוברי גלים והם הרבה יותר צרים. ישנן 3 סיבות להתנגדויות לתוכנית:

נזק סביבתי בלתי הפיך!  בדיוק כמו בחופים אחרים בארץ, יציקת בטון על פני החוף תגרום לגריפה גדולה של חולות, ובסופו של דבר ייעלם לגמרי שאר החוף.  (ראו את הדוח ובמיוחד את התמונות בסופו)

רחבה מידי!  טיילת של 7-17 מ’ על חוף שרוחבו בין 20-35 מ’ מוחקת כמעט חצי מהמקום הפנוי.  יש מקומות שישארו פחות מ-5 מ’ חול יבש בין הטיילת לים!  (ראו: החוף החדש).

בקושי חוקי!  העירייה בעצם אישרה בעצמה את התוכנית משלה, בלי להתייעץ עם גופים ארציים ומומחי הסביבה כמו שדרוש. לא בוצע שום תסקיר סביבתי כדי לברר את הנזקים שייגרמו לחוף כתוצאה מהבנייה. לא נשקלו פתרונות ידידותיים לסביבה. לא נשמעה דעת הציבור.

Help us protect the beach and prevent the municipality from building a concrete pavement on the beach which already is narrow. We the citizens (toshavim) and surfers (golshim) want to preserve the beautiful sandy beach and protect it from the damages that will occur from sand erosion.

 

מחלקים טי-שירטים כמו אלה בתמונה למי שתורם
story_txt:
עזרו לנו להגן על חוף זבולון ולמנוע מהעירייה לבנות טיילת מבטון שתגרום לסחיפת החול ולנזק בלתי הפיך לחוף. מעל 6,000 איש חתמו על העצומה ועוד 4,000 חברים הביעו תמיכה בפייסבוק. עלינו לפעול לפני חידוש העבודות בחוף. עזרו לנו ככל יכולתכם, שמרו על קשר והתעדכנו בדף הפייסבוק.
כשבונים קירות או מבנים מבטון בחוף הדבר גורם לגריפת החול על ידי הים, החוף נעלם ונשארת רק מדרכה. בחוף דדו בחיפה, בנהריה, בחוף השרון ובחוף הנפרד בהרצליה זה כבר קרה, חוף סידני עלי נהרס כולו ועכשיו העיריה רוצה לעשות את זה גם בחוף זבולון. טיילת שלב א' נבנתה במקום שיש שוברי גלים והחוף רחב. בזבולון החוף צר מאוד והנזק יהיה בלתי הפיך.


אנחנו דורשים לביטול היתר הבניה והתחלת הליך תכנוני בשיתוף הציבור תוך הצגת חלופות לבניה שלא תפגע בחוף.  תוכנית חדשה צריכה לעבור את כל הערוצים והוועדות הרלוונטיות, להתאים לרוחב החוף, ולהיבנות בצורה שתקטין את הנזק העתידי לסביבה.
מטה המאבק לשמירה על חופי הרצליה מנהל מאבק לעצירת העבודות בחוף זבולון עד שימצא פתרון שלא יגרום נזק סביבתי בלתי הפיך. דעת הציבור לא נשמע בהליך מסודר ובוועדות המתאימות. אנו המנהלים את המאבק זקוקים מידית לכסף בכדי לנהל מאבק משפטי וציבורי מול עיריית הרצליה לעצירה מיידית של עבודות בניית הטיילת שעולה כ 16 מליון ש"ח לתושבי הרצליה. 
אנו מגישים עתירה מנהלית לבית המשפט המחוזי וזקוקים לכ 80,000 ש"ח בהוצאות משפטיות. 
אנו בעד הנגשת החוף לכלל הציבור אך חשוב להבין שבניגוד לטיילת הדרומית ליד המרינה, חוף דבוש וחוף זבולון אינם מוגנים ע”י שוברי גלים והם הרבה יותר צרים. ישנן 3 סיבות להתנגדויות לתוכנית:
נזק סביבתי בלתי הפיך!  בדיוק כמו בחופים אחרים בארץ, יציקת בטון על פני החוף תגרום לגריפה גדולה של חולות, ובסופו של דבר ייעלם לגמרי שאר החוף.  (ראו את הדוח ובמיוחד את התמונות בסופו)
רחבה מידי!  טיילת של 7-17 מ’ על חוף שרוחבו בין 20-35 מ’ מוחקת כמעט חצי מהמקום הפנוי.  יש מקומות שישארו פחות מ-5 מ’ חול יבש בין הטיילת לים!  (ראו: החוף החדש).
בקושי חוקי!  העירייה בעצם אישרה בעצמה את התוכנית משלה, בלי להתייעץ עם גופים ארציים ומומחי הסביבה כמו שדרוש. לא בוצע שום תסקיר סביבתי כדי לברר את הנזקים שייגרמו לחוף כתוצאה מהבנייה. לא נשקלו פתרונות ידידותיים לסביבה. לא נשמעה דעת הציבור.

Help us protect the beach and prevent the municipality from building a concrete pavement on the beach which already is narrow. We the citizens (toshavim) and surfers (golshim) want to preserve the beautiful sandy beach and protect it from the damages that will occur from sand erosion.

story:
Avec toute l'attention qui est portée sur l'alimentention saine, l'achat de produits locaux et les dangers des pesticides, il devient de plus en plus populaire de se faire un potager chez soi.
 
Par contre, plusieurs trouvent que c'est trop compliqué et trop demandant.
Ces personnes sont susceptibles de payer pour obtenir les services d'un professionnel pour créer un potager chez elles ou bien les aider à démarrer leur potager.

Une serre et un camion

C'est tout ce que ça prend comme investissement !
 
Une serre pour préparer les semis à planter chez les clients.
Je dirais que nous avons besoin d'environ 2000 $ pour la serre. (j'ai déja une structure d'abris d'auto)
 
Une petite camionette pour transporter le compost, le bois, les équipements etc...
 

L'impact

Notre projet à un potentiel positif énorme ! Quand on parle de manger local et Bio, on ne fait pas mieux!

100% Bio. Donc des aliments sains sans aucuns pesticides.


Semences certifées biologiques et du patrimoines. Donc des légumes et fruits gouteux et nourissants.

Très faible empreinte écologique !

Peu d'entretien : le compagnonnage et les abris préviennent les maladies et l'arrivée d'insectes nuisibles.

Très forte production. La méthode que nous utilisons est très intensive et extrèmement productive !


C'est notre emploie de rêve !!!!!! Nous ne croyons pas pouvoir nous sentir plus accompli autrement !

 

Donc, peu d'investissement qui engendre énormément de retombés positives pour l'environnement et la communauté !

 

Vous pouvez aussi nous aider en nous envoyant vos semences !

 

Contactez-nous par courriel !

Avec toute l'attention qui est portée sur l'alimentention saine, l'achat de produits locaux et les dangers des pesticides, il devient de plus en plus populaire de se faire un potager chez soi.
 
Par contre, plusieurs trouvent que c'est trop compliqué et trop demandant.
Ces personnes sont susceptibles de payer pour obtenir les services d'un professionnel pour créer un potager chez elles ou bien les aider à démarrer leur potager.

Une serre et un camion
C'est tout ce que ça prend comme investissement !
 
Une serre pour préparer les semis à planter chez les clients.
Je dirais que nous avons besoin d'environ 2000 $ pour la serre. (j'ai déja une structure d'abris d'auto)
 
Une petite camionette pour transporter le compost, le bois, les équipements etc...
 

L'impact
Notre projet à un potentiel positif énorme ! Quand on parle de manger local et Bio, on ne fait pas mieux!
100% Bio. Donc des aliments sains sans aucuns pesticides.
Semences certifées biologiques et du patrimoines. Donc des légumes et fruits gouteux et nourissants.
Très faible empreinte écologique !
Peu d'entretien : le compagnonnage et les abris préviennent les maladies et l'arrivée d'insectes nuisibles.
Très forte production. La méthode que nous utilisons est très intensive et extrèmement productive !
C'est notre emploie de rêve !!!!!! Nous ne croyons pas pouvoir nous sentir plus accompli autrement !
 
Donc, peu d'investissement qui engendre énormément de retombés positives pour l'environnement et la communauté !

 
Vous pouvez aussi nous aider en nous envoyant vos semences !
 
Contactez-nous par courriel !

story:
Short Summary

Fracking Western Maryland is the most divisive issue in the state since the Civil War. There are 2 distinct world views competing for primacy. We have been documenting this debate for over 18 months and have released a 67 minute documentary about the political process in 2015 that resulted in a 2 year moratorium that will expire in 2017. New fracking regulations are being proposed and commented on now. This campaign will allow us to continue documenting this debate and provide continuing social media coverage and journalistic support to the Oakland Republican Newspaper. This is a report shot June 27 at an MDE presentation in Baltimore. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our budget is $25,000 which will cover dedicated reporting via video, still photography and written copy for the next 3-4 months. This budget will allow us to go to Dimock to document the places and events that Craig, Ray and Lee describe in their comments to Secretary Grumbles and MDE above. We will invite our elected representatives, Secretary Grumbles, Gas & Oil Industry representatives, anti-fracking activists and others to reflect on this process and help educate Maryland voters in video and print interviews. The budget will allow us to hire additional videographers, photographers and writer/reporters as needed. We will continue the process we started 18 months ago and add the print reach and reputation of the almost 140 year old newspaper. For your investment you will receive what amounts to the Maryland "Fracking News Network" via You tube, facebook the "Republican". All of the footage and research will be archived for use in a "Fracking Western Maryland? 2" documentary.

The Impact

The people most affected by this debate in Western Maryland are the most removed from the Annapolis statehouse debate by their isolation from Baltimore media sources. This project keeps them informed and up to date.   



Risks & Challenges

We have been covering the Maryland Fracking debate for 18 months. We stretched a $10,000 Kickstarter campaign into a 67 minute documentary that is available via DVD & Social Media and has been shown in theatres and at a film festival. We can't afford to do that again. It takes too much time and resource to accomplish properly. If we fall short of the $25,000 goal we will provide as much coverage as possible on the budget we have. If we exceed that goal it will go toward editing and distributing "Fracking Western Marylnad? 2" before the 2017 legislative session begins in Maryland.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Everyone can help by sharing this and spreading the word. Small donations add up. 

  • If this matters to you please help...just take a minute
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
UPDATE VIDEO:

 
TEASER VIDEO:

 

Target: R1 000 000 ($70 000 / £52 000 / €62 000) 

Deadline: 31 October 2016​ - EXTENDED TO 21 NOVEMBER!!!

SO WATCH THIS SPACE for updates on the LAND, the EXHIBITION and HOW YOU CAN HELP:​

#1000PrintsNoFootPrints

On Instagram: @chris_auret

Facebook: facebook.com/auretart

& my Website: www.auret-art.com

Facebook 1000Prints Catalogue Preview​

​
 

WHY R 1000 000 ($70 000 / £52 000 / €62 000)? ​

R1 000 000 is the amount needed to purchase an 11-Hectare plot of land up the East Coast of South Africa, where I aim to undertake a lifetime project of Reforestation Work and to build a Creative Retreat.

I currently have first option on the sale of the property but the offer to purchase must be made before the end of October, when the property will be placed on the market for other buyers. I had been searching for land when this space found me, just a few weeks ago. Born out of frustration at the current state of our fragile world, I realised the need for personal action. To be the CHANGE I want to see. To start a way of life moving with nature, instead of against it. As well as a need for a quiet space to facilitate artistic and spiritual practices. And then to share that space with others. ​

I am 100% certain this is the space for the vision.  And I need your help to join me in making this dream a reality. It's not just my vision, it's your vision and therefore OUR VISION. It's still growing and has endless possibilities for the greater good of our environment and our creative hearts.​

​

WHY #1000PrintsNoFootPrints ?

The campaign is based on the idea of gifting a Limited Edition & Signed Print as a reward for a donation of R1000 ($70 / £52 / €62). 

​

1000 Prints x R1000  = R1 000 000! ​

 

Will you be 1 of those 1000 or MORE?!​

As truthful as most clichés sound, every little bit counts, BIG or SMALL!​

  • For every R1000 ($70) donated, you will be rewarded with another print.​
  • For donations less than R1000 ($70), DON'T WORRY! We still love you! You will also be rewarded with a Limited Edition & Signed POSTCARD, of your choice and more (see details below).​
  • PRINTS will be just smaller than A3 in size, POSTCARDS will be A5 in size.​
  • FREE DISTRIBUTION & POSTAGE TO ALL MAJOR CITIES AROUND THE WORLD.​
  • ALL DONATIONS to receive downloads of MUSIC & WRITINGS by myself and friends.​
  • ECO-FRIENDLY PRINTING​
  • ALL DONATORS ARE INVITED TO VISIT THE LAND ONCE IN OUR HANDS!

See Full REWARDS BREAK DOWN

VISION FOR THE LAND?​

1. Erase Our Human Footprints as Far and Wide as Possible:​

  • Revival of the bordering Indigenous, Afrotemporate, Forest and Fynbos, up and over the land itself.
  • Reforestation; by eradicating the invasive alien species such as Pine, Wattle and Blue gum across the property.
  • Preservation of the endangered plant and animal species in the area.
  • Practice Sustainable Living:
    • Eco-construction: Using alien vegetation from property as a building and monetary resource
    • Use of Recycled and Eco-friendly materials for building, e.g. tyres, glass, clay, wood, etc
    • Use of New Age, sustainable, building models, e.g. earth-ships, temporary structures, wood cabins, etc.
    • Extensive Permaculture methods
    • Community involvement 
    • As many Off-the grid living methods as possible; such as solar power, collection of rain water, eco-friendly toilets, etc
    • Production of Bee-Friendly Fynbos Honey

2. To Build a Creative Retreat:​

  • A space for you to escape the chaotic and estranged urban environment, to explore yourself within the nature.
  • A place to write a book, record an album, paint a series of works, read up on that topic you’ve always wanted to read up on but never had quite the stillness or the energy to do so.
  • A space to DO WHATEVER YOU WANT, while supporting a GOOD CAUSE. 
  • A space being Yours to visit, therefore OURS more than just mine. ​​
The #1000PrintsNoFootprints Team introduces Werner and some of the friendly neighbours surrounding the plot of land that we are raising the R1 Million for in the video above!
 

WHO AM I, CHRIS AURET?​

  • A South African Artist and Maker of things (paintings, murals, photographs, films, writings, sounds and more), currently residing in Cape Town. (WEBSITE)
  • Full, detailed, biography HERE
  • A man on a mission for the greater good of our environment with you.

#1000PrintsNoFootPrints

On Instagram: @chris_auret

Facebook: facebook.com/auretart

& my Website: www.auret-art.com/

Facebook 1000Prints Catalogue Preview

 

PHYSICAL & ONLINE EXHIBITION

In connection with the Reward System of Crowdfunding, I (Chris Auret) will be hosting an Online and Physical Exhibition of art available as rewards for donations towards the campaign. The show will be made made primarily of Limited Edition Prints of original paintings and photographs of personal work, but also include writings, films, sounds and more by myself, as well collaborators and friends. These rewards will vary depending on the value of their donation.​

The full exhibition of rewards will LAUNCH ONLY 13 October Online and Physically (13 - 23 October), when you as a contributor will be able to view your reward.​

Contributors of R1000 ($70) or more towards the Indiegogo Campaign, will be able to select an artwork from the Prints Catalogue, with free distribution and postage to all major cities in the World, upon the campaign reaching its target of R1 000 000 ($70 000) before 21 November.

R1000 x 1000 Prints = R1 000 000 Target!​

See FULL PRINT CATALOGUE

See Full REWARDS BREAK DOWN​

Below are some photos from the Physical Gallery space of Prints

​

R1 000 000 ($70 000) – A FIXED TARGET on Indiegogo:

It is ALL-OR-NOTHING for the campaign and therefore the land and will result in a refund for contributors in the event of the target not being reached by 21 November (meaning no Prints to be rewarded too). I had to make this decision, to further my commitment towards the cause. I also felt it would inspire a sense of urgency for the general public to ACT NOW, not only for the campaign but in their own personal lives for the good of the environment. This campaign is almost based on the concept of "Actions Speak Louder Than Words". As a human being, this is OUR action. And it will cause a reaction.​

​

ACTIONS SPEAK LOUDER THAN WORDS

(PERFORMANCE PIECE):​

To show my dedication towards the cause, my faith in the power of community and good intention, draw attention to the campaign, as well as to personally challenge myself and my commitments, I will be taking a vow of absolute silence and living in the gallery window throughout the 10 days of the physical exhibition. Essentially, I will be a homeless man on display for the world. I will remain confined to the window, even if the target has been reached, practicing meditation each day and live-painting a piece to be auctioned off at the end of the exhibition.​ There will hopefully be a live web-cam of the performance online.

It is extremely important to know there will be more information on the exhibition in the days and weeks to follow.​

Below are some available Prints (View Full Catalogue)

Chris Auret - "Broken Home (N2, South Africa)" - www.auret-art.com

Cassandra Hellberg - "The long winding road following the path of your heart" - www.rainbowsage.com

Nick Burton-Moore - “Head in the Crowds” - http://bit.ly/2dsUuWX

Mikey Burey - www.mikeyburey.co.uk  // Instagram: @mikeyburey

 

REWARDS BREAKDOWN:​

R1000 ($70 / £52 / €62):​

  • 1 x Limited Edition & Signed Print of your choice from the catalogue of paintings and photographs + A NIGHTACCOMMODATION ON THE LAND IN THE YEAR TO FOLLOW :)
  • Hand-delivered by myself or a member of the team to as many supporters as possible in Cape Town.
  • Distribution and postage FREE to all major cities around the world.
  • Free download of, never-been-released, MUSIC & WRITINGS by myself and friends​

 FOR EVERY EXTRA R1000 ($70 / £52 / €62):​

  • Another Limited Edition & Signed Print of your choice from the catalogue of paintings and photographs!
  • R3000 = 3 x Prints, R10 000  = 10 Prints, R41 000 = 41 Prints
  • $210 = 3 Prints, $7000 = 10 Prints, $2870 = 41 Prints, etc
  • Hand-delivered by myself or a member of the team to as many supporters as possible in Cape Town.
  • Distribution and postage FREE to all major cities around the world.
  • Free download of, never-been-released, MUSIC & WRITINGS by myself and friends​

LESS THAN R1000 ($70)​

  • 1 x Limited Edition & Signed POSTCARD of your choice from the catalogue of paintings and photographs.
  • Distribution and postage FREE to all major cities around the world.
  • Free download of, never-been-released, MUSIC & WRITINGS by myself and friends
  • One heartfelt high five of the utmost gratitude, while providing a space to pitch a tent when you feel like getting out and hacking away at some good old invasive Wattle.​

NEW PERKS:​

$10 - Yet You Matter None The Less!

Free download of, never-been-released MUSIC & WRITINGS by myself and friends - As well as a small, personalised, digital sketch by myself, Chris Auret​

$25 - A Little Long Way

  • 1 x Limited Edition & POSTCARD of your choice from the catalogue of paintings and photographs.
  • Distribution and postage FREE to all major cities around the world.
  • Free download of, never-been-released, MUSIC & WRITINGS by myself and friends
  • One heartfelt high five of the utmost gratitude, while providing a space to pitch a tent when you feel like getting out and hacking away at some good old invasive Wattle.

$370 - (R5000) Painting Commission

  • 1 x A3 Painting Commission (Portrait or Landscape) of the contributors OWN IMAGE SUBMISSION + A WEEK ACCOMMODATION ON THE LAND IN THE YEAR TO FOLLOW :)
  • 5 x LTD EDITION ECO-FRIENDLY PRINTS of your choice from the catalogue.
  • HAND-DELIVERED to as many supporters as possible in Cape Town.
  • FREE DISTRIBUTION & POSTAGE to all major cities around the world.
  • FREE DOWNLOAD of, never-been-released, MUSIC & WRITINGS by myself and friends.

It’s important to note will be investing my own savings, separate to the target itself, into the material for printing and postage. Obviously, you, as the donator, are free to include postage/shipping costs into your contribution. It would be greatly appreciated :)​

In the event of a SUCCESSFUL CAMPAIGN, the process of printing and distributing the Rewards will take place slowly over the months to follow; November, December & January.​

YOU WILL BE CONSTANTLY UPDATED, as I ask for your patience and trust in me to DELIVER REWARDS TO YOU OVER TIME!​

MAKE SURE YOU ADD THE SHIPPING ADDRESS FOR POSTAGE!

CHRIS AURET PRINTS CATALOGUE​

 "& FRIENDS" PRINTS CATALOGUE​

​

IMPORTANT TO NOTE:​

  • Upon the SUCCESS OF THE CAMPAIGN the Limited Number of Prints will be CAPPED
  • EXCHANGE RATES WILL VARY and above amounts are JUST ESTIMATES.

​

PHYSICAL AND ONLINE EXHIBITION 13 - 21 November 2016:​

  • DONATIONS ARE OPEN NOW as contributors leave contact details for their Rewards to be chosen UPON CAMPAIGN SUCCESS.
  • ONLINE via my Website & Indiegogo
  • PHYSICAL show to take place at the MUTI GALLERY, in Cape Town (13 - 23 Oct). Facebook Event details HERE, housing a small metaphor for the land itself with environmental discussions, film screenings, poetry nights, yoga, meditations, live music and more. 
  • THE EXHIBITION HAS GONE LIVE. You are able to VIEW THE FULL CATALOGUE of Art and choose your Reward, depending on your donation at the end of the campaign.
  • The campaign will peak with the opening of the PHYSICAL exhibition, housed at the MUTI GALLERY in Cape Town, where a number of Original Works and Prints will be on display. Afterwards the exhibition will be on the move!
  • During the physical exhibition, I will be doing somewhat of a performance piece, taking a VOW OF ABSOLUTE SILENCE AND LIVING IN THE GALLERY WINDOW FOR 10 DAYS.​

 

#1000PrintsNoFootPrints

On Instagram: @chris_auret

Facebook: facebook.com/auretart

& my Website: www.auret-art.com/

Facebook 1000Prints Catalogue Preview

 

PLEASE feel free to POST and SHARE ANYTHING I CREATE, using #1000PrintsNoFootPrints

 

FEEL FREE TO TAKE THE CAMPAIGN INTO YOUR OWN HANDS in order to raise money for the project or HELP SHARE IN THE VISION.

eg. door-to-door raffle sheets, wash cars, throw an event, go wild!

If you have any ideas or queries, CONTACT ME through my social media channels or on email at chrisauret@live.com, keeping in mind I may take a few days to respond.

OR you can try my good friend and assistant Cassandra Hellberg on email at: chellberg87@gmail.com

 

THANK YOU in advance for taking part in the campaign.

Thank you in advance for listening or reading.

Thank you in advance for your support. It means the world to me.

 

OH, HOW I LOVE YOU ALL!

 

Video Credits:

A film by Chris Auret

Nick Burton-Moore (youtube.com/watch?v=Fjo_bPurAek)

Second Camera & Edit: 
Chris Auret

Third Camera & Assistance: 
Cassandra Hellberg (http://www.rainbowsage.com/)

Gershan Lombard aka KHOISANBOY_MAN (soundcloud.com/gershan-1)

Title Animation: 
Ted Saczek

Featuring Matthew Koehorst

Additional Footage courtesy of:
The Muti Gallery (themutigallery.co.za/)
The Collectors Club (thecollectorsclub.com/)

With Special Thanks to Nixi & Txarani (pachamama.co.za/)
story_txt:
UPDATE VIDEO: TEASER VIDEO:

 
Target: R1 000 000 ($70 000 / £52 000 / €62 000) Deadline: 31 October 2016​ - EXTENDED TO 21 NOVEMBER!!!SO WATCH THIS SPACE for updates on the LAND, the EXHIBITION and HOW YOU CAN HELP:​#1000PrintsNoFootPrintsOn Instagram: @chris_auretFacebook: facebook.com/auretart& my Website: www.auret-art.comFacebook 1000Prints Catalogue Preview​
​ WHY R 1000 000 ($70 000 / £52 000 / €62 000)? ​R1 000 000 is the amount needed to purchase an 11-Hectare plot of land up the East Coast of South Africa, where I aim to undertake a lifetime project of Reforestation Work and to build a Creative Retreat.I currently have first option on the sale of the property but the offer to purchase must be made before the end of October, when the property will be placed on the market for other buyers. I had been searching for land when this space found me, just a few weeks ago. Born out of frustration at the current state of our fragile world, I realised the need for personal action. To be the CHANGE I want to see. To start a way of life moving with nature, instead of against it. As well as a need for a quiet space to facilitate artistic and spiritual practices. And then to share that space with others. ​I am 100% certain this is the space for the vision.  And I need your help to join me in making this dream a reality. It's not just my vision, it's your vision and therefore OUR VISION. It's still growing and has endless possibilities for the greater good of our environment and our creative hearts.​​WHY #1000PrintsNoFootPrints ?The campaign is based on the idea of gifting a Limited Edition & Signed Print as a reward for a donation of R1000 ($70 / £52 / €62). ​1000 Prints x R1000  = R1 000 000! ​ Will you be 1 of those 1000 or MORE?!​As truthful as most clichés sound, every little bit counts, BIG or SMALL!​

For every R1000 ($70) donated, you will be rewarded with another print.​

For donations less than R1000 ($70), DON'T WORRY! We still love you! You will also be rewarded with a Limited Edition & Signed POSTCARD, of your choice and more (see details below).​

PRINTS will be just smaller than A3 in size, POSTCARDS will be A5 in size.​

FREE DISTRIBUTION & POSTAGE TO ALL MAJOR CITIES AROUND THE WORLD.​

ALL DONATIONS to receive downloads of MUSIC & WRITINGS by myself and friends.​

ECO-FRIENDLY PRINTING​
ALL DONATORS ARE INVITED TO VISIT THE LAND ONCE IN OUR HANDS!
See Full REWARDS BREAK DOWNVISION FOR THE LAND?​1. Erase Our Human Footprints as Far and Wide as Possible:​

Revival of the bordering Indigenous, Afrotemporate, Forest and Fynbos, up and over the land itself.

Reforestation; by eradicating the invasive alien species such as Pine, Wattle and Blue gum across the property.

Preservation of the endangered plant and animal species in the area.

Practice Sustainable Living:

Eco-construction: Using alien vegetation from property as a building and monetary resource

Use of Recycled and Eco-friendly materials for building, e.g. tyres, glass, clay, wood, etc

Use of New Age, sustainable, building models, e.g. earth-ships, temporary structures, wood cabins, etc.
Extensive Permaculture methods
Community involvement 
As many Off-the grid living methods as possible; such as solar power, collection of rain water, eco-friendly toilets, etc
Production of Bee-Friendly Fynbos Honey



2. To Build a Creative Retreat:​
A space for you to escape the chaotic and estranged urban environment, to explore yourself within the nature.


A place to write a book, record an album, paint a series of works, read up on that topic you’ve always wanted to read up on but never had quite the stillness or the energy to do so.
A space to DO WHATEVER YOU WANT, while supporting a GOOD CAUSE. 

A space being Yours to visit, therefore OURS more than just mine. ​​
The #1000PrintsNoFootprints Team introduces Werner and some of the friendly neighbours surrounding the plot of land that we are raising the R1 Million for in the video above! WHO AM I, CHRIS AURET?​

A South African Artist and Maker of things (paintings, murals, photographs, films, writings, sounds and more), currently residing in Cape Town. (WEBSITE)

Full, detailed, biography HERE

A man on a mission for the greater good of our environment with you.
#1000PrintsNoFootPrintsOn Instagram: @chris_auretFacebook: facebook.com/auretart& my Website: www.auret-art.com/Facebook 1000Prints Catalogue Preview PHYSICAL & ONLINE EXHIBITIONIn connection with the Reward System of Crowdfunding, I (Chris Auret) will be hosting an Online and Physical Exhibition of art available as rewards for donations towards the campaign. The show will be made made primarily of Limited Edition Prints of original paintings and photographs of personal work, but also include writings, films, sounds and more by myself, as well collaborators and friends. These rewards will vary depending on the value of their donation.​The full exhibition of rewards will LAUNCH ONLY 13 October Online and Physically (13 - 23 October), when you as a contributor will be able to view your reward.​Contributors of R1000 ($70) or more towards the Indiegogo Campaign, will be able to select an artwork from the Prints Catalogue, with free distribution and postage to all major cities in the World, upon the campaign reaching its target of R1 000 000 ($70 000) before 21 November.
R1000 x 1000 Prints = R1 000 000 Target!​See FULL PRINT CATALOGUESee Full REWARDS BREAK DOWN​Below are some photos from the Physical Gallery space of Prints​R1 000 000 ($70 000) – A FIXED TARGET on Indiegogo:It is ALL-OR-NOTHING for the campaign and therefore the land and will result in a refund for contributors in the event of the target not being reached by 21 November (meaning no Prints to be rewarded too). I had to make this decision, to further my commitment towards the cause. I also felt it would inspire a sense of urgency for the general public to ACT NOW, not only for the campaign but in their own personal lives for the good of the environment. This campaign is almost based on the concept of "Actions Speak Louder Than Words". As a human being, this is OUR action. And it will cause a reaction.​​ACTIONS SPEAK LOUDER THAN WORDS(PERFORMANCE PIECE):​To show my dedication towards the cause, my faith in the power of community and good intention, draw attention to the campaign, as well as to personally challenge myself and my commitments, I will be taking a vow of absolute silence and living in the gallery window throughout the 10 days of the physical exhibition. Essentially, I will be a homeless man on display for the world. I will remain confined to the window, even if the target has been reached, practicing meditation each day and live-painting a piece to be auctioned off at the end of the exhibition.​ There will hopefully be a live web-cam of the performance online.It is extremely important to know there will be more information on the exhibition in the days and weeks to follow.​Below are some available Prints (View Full Catalogue)Chris Auret - "Broken Home (N2, South Africa)" - www.auret-art.comCassandra Hellberg - "The long winding road following the path of your heart" - www.rainbowsage.comNick Burton-Moore - “Head in the Crowds” - http://bit.ly/2dsUuWXMikey Burey - www.mikeyburey.co.uk  // Instagram: @mikeyburey 
REWARDS BREAKDOWN:​R1000 ($70 / £52 / €62):​
1 x Limited Edition & Signed Print of your choice from the catalogue of paintings and photographs + A NIGHTACCOMMODATION ON THE LAND IN THE YEAR TO FOLLOW :)

Hand-delivered by myself or a member of the team to as many supporters as possible in Cape Town.


Distribution and postage FREE to all major cities around the world.

Free download of, never-been-released, MUSIC & WRITINGS by myself and friends​
 FOR EVERY EXTRA R1000 ($70 / £52 / €62):​

Another Limited Edition & Signed Print of your choice from the catalogue of paintings and photographs!
R3000 = 3 x Prints, R10 000  = 10 Prints, R41 000 = 41 Prints
$210 = 3 Prints, $7000 = 10 Prints, $2870 = 41 Prints, etc

Hand-delivered by myself or a member of the team to as many supporters as possible in Cape Town.


Distribution and postage FREE to all major cities around the world.

Free download of, never-been-released, MUSIC & WRITINGS by myself and friends​
LESS THAN R1000 ($70)​

1 x Limited Edition & Signed POSTCARD of your choice from the catalogue of paintings and photographs.

Distribution and postage FREE to all major cities around the world.

Free download of, never-been-released, MUSIC & WRITINGS by myself and friends

One heartfelt high five of the utmost gratitude, while providing a space to pitch a tent when you feel like getting out and hacking away at some good old invasive Wattle.​
NEW PERKS:​$10 - Yet You Matter None The Less!Free download of, never-been-released MUSIC & WRITINGS by myself and friends - As well as a small, personalised, digital sketch by myself, Chris Auret​$25 - A Little Long Way
1 x Limited Edition & POSTCARD of your choice from the catalogue of paintings and photographs.
Distribution and postage FREE to all major cities around the world.
Free download of, never-been-released, MUSIC & WRITINGS by myself and friends
One heartfelt high five of the utmost gratitude, while providing a space to pitch a tent when you feel like getting out and hacking away at some good old invasive Wattle.

HAND-DELIVERED to as many supporters as possible in Cape Town.

FREE DOWNLOAD of, never-been-released, MUSIC & WRITINGS by myself and friends.

Upon the SUCCESS OF THE CAMPAIGN the Limited Number of Prints will be CAPPED
EXCHANGE RATES WILL VARY and above amounts are JUST ESTIMATES.
​PHYSICAL AND ONLINE EXHIBITION 13 - 21 November 2016:​

DONATIONS ARE OPEN NOW as contributors leave contact details for their Rewards to be chosen UPON CAMPAIGN SUCCESS.


ONLINE via my Website & Indiegogo


PHYSICAL show to take place at the MUTI GALLERY, in Cape Town (13 - 23 Oct). Facebook Event details HERE, housing a small metaphor for the land itself with environmental discussions, film screenings, poetry nights, yoga, meditations, live music and more. 


THE EXHIBITION HAS GONE LIVE. You are able to VIEW THE FULL CATALOGUE of Art and choose your Reward, depending on your donation at the end of the campaign.
The campaign will peak with the opening of the PHYSICAL exhibition, housed at the MUTI GALLERY in Cape Town, where a number of Original Works and Prints will be on display. Afterwards the exhibition will be on the move!

story:
For English scroll down

ReBo

Hola!

Te presentamos al ReBo, una máquina inteligente que se colocará en espacios públicos creada para solucionar los problemas de reciclaje en México. ReBo recibe PET, latas y colillas de cigarro y se encarga de catalogarlos y comprimirlos para posteriormente reciclarlos de manera eficiente.

¡A cambio de sus reciclables la gente recibirá puntos ReBo para intercambiar posteriormente por recompensas como WiFi, descuentos en restaurantes y viajes en Cabify!

 

¿Cúal es el impacto de ReBo?

Queremos motivar a la gente a reciclar y a cambiar el concepto negativo de basura para comenzar a verlo como un activo. Reciclando nuestra basura, podemos dejar de contaminar significativamente; por ejemplo, ¡Reciclar 1 lata  ahorra hasta el 95% de la enegría que se utilizaría para crear una nueva a partir de materiales vírgenes!

Además de motivar a la gente a reciclar, ReBo ayuda a eficientar los costos y tiempos de reciclaje ya que reduce de manera significativa el largo ciclo de pasos que se llevan a cabo en el sistema de reciclaje actual. Además de separar y comprimir los reciclables, ReBo es capaz de generar una ruta de recolección inteligente a lo largo de los ReBos que ya están llenos para que tiempo y recursos no sean gastados en vano.

 

¿Cómo nos ayudas?

¡Con tu fondeo podremos construir muchos ReBos y colocarlos en espacios públicos! El dinero que obtengamos lo utilizaremos específicamente para comprar materias primas para la producción de ReBo y para mejorar nuestro taller de tal manera que maximicemos nuestras capacidades de producción.

¡A cambio de tu ayuda recibirás recompensas increíbles! ¡La mayoría de ellas son objetos creativos creados por nosotros con materiales reciclables!

 

¿Por qué ReBo?

Creamos ReBo al darnos cuenta de los deficiente que era el sistema de reciclaje en México. Buscamos generar un cambio en nuestra comunidad, creemos que reciclar puede convertirse en parte de nuestra cultura del día a día.

 

Sorpéndete de ReBo

ReBo es un proyecto capaz de formar parte de nuestro presente y futuro. Esta máquina está creada bajo el modelo de economía circular; Es decir, que sus partes pueden ser intercambiadas conforme el tiempo y la tecnología avanza sin la necesidad de tirar y construir un nuevo ReBo, convirtiéndose así en “FutureProof technology”.

 

Nuestros incentivos

¡Te dejamos una foto de los lapiceros que imprimimos en 3D! Por ahora nos encontramos produciendo el resto de los incentivos que daremos. En cuanto tengamos más fotos que compartirte las subieremos.

 

ReBo (English)

Hey!

We introduce you to ReBo, an intelligent machine that will be placed in public spaces (such as parks, malls, and restaurants) created to solve Mexico's recycling problematic. ReBo receives PET, cans and cigarette butts and takes charge of cataloging and compressing them in order to later on recycle them efficiently.

¡In exchange for their recyclables people will receive ReBo points to swap later on for rewards such as WiFi, restaurant discounts and cab rides!

How does ReBo has a high impact on society?

We want to motivate people to recycle and change their negative conception of garbage towards the idea of it as an active. Recycling our garbage we can remarkably reduce our carbon footprint; for example, ¡Recycling 1 can saves up to 95% of the energy that would be used to make a new one from virgin materials!

Aside from encouraging people to recycle, ReBo helps to streamline recycling costs and times as it reduces the large cycle of steps followed by the current recycling system. In addition to separating and compressing recyclables, ReBo is capable to create a smart collection route according to the ReBos that are already full so time and resources are not wasted in vain.

What We Need & What You Get

With your funding we are going to be able to build up more ReBos and place them in public spaces. We will specifically use the money to buy prime materials for ReBo production and to improve our workshop in order to maximize our production capacities.

In exchange for your help we have amazing rewards! Most of them are very creative treats made by ourselves with recycled materials!

ReBo Excellence

story:
The Solar Seed Fund Model



Support this campaign and invest in solar energy for our communities.

For every $1 donated Kehilla will save $2 over the life of the solar energy system.

For every $1 donated RE-volv will be able to invest $3 more in solar.

So every $1 donated generates an additional $5 worth of benefit!


Summary

Do you support renewable energy?  Do you want to help build a clean energy future in our communities today? If so, you’ve come to the right campaign!

By supporting this campaign, you will help finance a solar energy system for the Kehilla Community Synagogue. This will save them $130,000 during the life of the system. Plus it'll replace grid electricity that would have emitted 14,490 lbs. of carbon dioxide each year, with clean solar energy!  More importantly, you will be investing in our Solar Seed Fund, a revolving fund that pays your donation forward to create solar energy projects today and tomorrow.

How it works

By donating to the Solar Seed Fund, you’re investing in this solar energy project and future projects for other nonprofits and cooperatives.  The Solar Seed Fund pays for solar energy installations on local community centers that pay RE-volv back over time through the savings on their energy bill.  RE-volv reinvests the principal and the revenues it earns on each project into additional solar projects—an average of 3 to 5 projects!  By investing in the Solar Seed Fund you will multiply your donation over time as we continually invest in more projects.  All donations to this campaign are tax-deductible.

About our perks

All of our perks were selected carefully by our team to support your passion for the environment and to help you reduce your carbon footprint.  Take your RE-volv tote bag with you to the grocery store, or use it to pack up your essentials to go hiking. Power up with your very own solar-powered phone charger.  Have dinner with our team to learn more about RE-volv or we will even send our Executive Director straight to you and your community.  No matter how much you donate, we hope you enjoy our gift to you!

Of course the biggest perk of all is knowing that each dollar invested in solar today will benefit the community and the environment for years to come.

Spread the word!

We need your help to spread the word about our campaign and about renewable energy.  Invite your family, friends, coworkers, and neighbors to join the movement! Together we can make solar energy a reality in our communities today.  Find us on Facebook and Twitter, and be sure to sign up for our mailing list to hear about RE-volv’s latest updates!

Supporting Organizations
Our partners are helping us spread the word about this campaign to people who want to support solar in our communities! Many thanks to our Supporting Organizations.
story_txt: The Solar Seed Fund ModelSupport this campaign and invest in solar energy for our communities.For every $1 donated Kehilla will save $2 over the life of the solar energy system.For every $1 donated RE-volv will be able to invest $3 more in solar.So every $1 donated generates an additional $5 worth of benefit!SummaryDo you support renewable energy?  Do you want to help build a clean energy future in our communities today? If so, you’ve come to the right campaign!By supporting this campaign, you will help finance a solar energy system for the Kehilla Community Synagogue. This will save them $130,000 during the life of the system. Plus it'll replace grid electricity that would have emitted 14,490 lbs. of carbon dioxide each year, with clean solar energy!  More importantly, you will be investing in our Solar Seed Fund, a revolving fund that pays your donation forward to create solar energy projects today and tomorrow.How it worksBy donating to the Solar Seed Fund, you’re investing in this solar energy project and future projects for other nonprofits and cooperatives.  The Solar Seed Fund pays for solar energy installations on local community centers that pay RE-volv back over time through the savings on their energy bill.  RE-volv reinvests the principal and the revenues it earns on each project into additional solar projects—an average of 3 to 5 projects!  By investing in the Solar Seed Fund you will multiply your donation over time as we continually invest in more projects.  All donations to this campaign are tax-deductible.About our perksAll of our perks were selected carefully by our team to support your passion for the environment and to help you reduce your carbon footprint.  Take your RE-volv tote bag with you to the grocery store, or use it to pack up your essentials to go hiking. Power up with your very own solar-powered phone charger.  Have dinner with our team to learn more about RE-volv or we will even send our Executive Director straight to you and your community.  No matter how much you donate, we hope you enjoy our gift to you! Of course the biggest perk of all is knowing that each dollar invested in solar today will benefit the community and the environment for years to come.Spread the word!We need your help to spread the word about our campaign and about renewable energy.  Invite your family, friends, coworkers, and neighbors to join the movement! Together we can make solar energy a reality in our communities today.  Find us on Facebook and Twitter, and be sure to sign up for our mailing list to hear about RE-volv’s latest updates!Supporting OrganizationsOur partners are helping us spread the word about this campaign to people who want to support solar in our communities! Many thanks to our Supporting Organizations.

story:
What if . . .

a tribal leader in Brazil shares wisdom about how we can change to be of benefit to the natural world with a farmer in Belgium and a financial analyst in Bangladesh?

Climate Changers will provide interactions with impact.

What if . . . a CEO in the UK shares a strategy to source 100% of the business' raw materials sustainably by 2020 not only with other CEO's, but with a teacher in the US and a social entrepreneur in Uganda?

Climate Changers will make inspiring connections real.

What if .  . . a community leader in Chicago shares how to reduce greenhouse gas levels by increasing the rate at which neighbor-owned businesses are created and sustained with a student in Calcutta and a computer programmer in Cape Town?

Climate Changers will bring informative relationships to life. Here is a sample of what the wide spectrum of people we envision being Climate Changers:

Informing. Inspiring. Igniting. Impacting.

Climate Changers is building an international online platform of individuals taking uplifting action to address climate change. Direct connections and interactions can be made with individuals taking action. These connections will be the catalysts transforming ripples into waves of positive, beneficial impact.

Climate Changers will come from business, government, organizations, communities and individuals stepping forward as global citizens doing what they can to make a difference. These Climate Changers will not only be reducing and reversing the negative impacts of climate change, they will be creating a more just and sustainable future.

Bringing depth and breadth to how we address climate change.

Here, you will find individuals from all over the planet sharing all kinds of actions that can be replicated or adapted. An action someone takes in Brazil can be taken by someone in Bangladesh and by someone in Botswana and by someone in British Columbia. Climate Changers is the means for making broad, impactful connections.

You will also find groups of individuals taking action that is focused on topics and issues you find of particular interest and importance. For example, you will be able to connect with a growing population of Climate Changers taking various actions on freshwater issues, or climate justice, farming technology, renewable energy and so forth. Here's an example of what a freshwater group will look like:

Every Climate Changer will have a introduction page and a profile page. Here's an example of an introduction and profile page. You'll notice the profile page contains the Climate Changers story and more detailed information as well as a point of contact:


Where the money will go.

It will go to build the Climate Changers online platform and bring this transformative project to the world. This includes:

• Building and programming the web site

• Outreach to individuals around the world inviting and engaging them to be Climate Changers

• Development of content for Climate Changer pages and in-depth profiles

• Design and production of Climate Changer pages and in-depth profiles

• Development of Climate Changers virtual summit

• Promotion of Climate Changers to obtain supporters, partners, collaborators and others vital connections necessary to expand our impact.

Climate Changers has been self-funded to this point and now it is time to move from idea to implementation. We figure it will initially take just $130,000 to bring Climate Changers to the world and fund our first year of work. Reaching our Indiegogo campaign goal of $50,000 will definitely put things in motion. Of course, it will be wonderful to surpass our goal!!

Who are we?

The founder and Project Director of Climate Changers is Jim Armstrong. He's devoted most of his career developing purpose-led communications for businesses and non-profits who have socially responsibility and sustainability as part of their DNA. The company he founded in 1999, Good for Business, was certified as a B Corp in 2010. Their client categories ranged from the environment, energy and education to healthcare, high technology and human rights. Jim's Climate Changers partner is his talented wife, Kathy, who serves as graphic designer and art director.

Climate Changers emerges from their experience in communications the the desire to take what they have learned and now apply it to the issue of our time.  Climate Changers also represents their desire to wake up every morning with hope and optimism regarding climate change instead of a sense of hopelessness and pessimism.

Climate Changers if a project of the Center for Transformative Action, a 501 (c)(3). Your donation today is tax deductible.

You can give climate change a hopeful, human face. Let's make a vital impact together!

We know Climate Changers isn't the only solution to climate change, but it definitely fills a critical void by delivering positive, 'can-do' solutions and innovations.bInternational in scope, this project realizes climate change has no borders. It focuses on sharing, collaborating and connecting with everyone who is taking action to address climate change and informing and inspiring others.

Your support will help bring to the world an international network of climate change agents eager to share the uplifting actions they are taking.

GIVE NOW!  THERE'S NO TIME TO LOSE AND SO MUCH TO GAIN.

Thanks!

story:
GIVE A TREE and be part of our Forest for a Lifetime!

Discovery Woods Learning Community is an outdoor education program with locations in Vienna and Great Falls.  Part of our mission is to provide our students with a chance to engage with nature as they grow and develop into responsible caretakers of their environment, and we need you to be a part of that mission.

As part of our recent expansion, we need a large number of native trees and shrubs. In addition to allowing us to meet county requirements (which will enable us to open our doors to a larger number of students), our trees  will be an integral part of our overall curriculum; they will be studied and loved as a core subject area for decades to come. Our director, Andrew Stoddard has been a farmer and horticulturalist for over 20 years, and he and our other staff and teachers will ensure that all donated trees are planted and tended with love and knowledge to ensure that they will stand as a beautiful part of our campus and as a testimony your donation.
 

What We Need 

We need to purchase and install 31 native trees and 52 native shrubs. Your contribution will live a lifetime! These beautiful trees and plants will grow and grace our campus for decades and decades. You will be greening our world and leaving a lasting legacy. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you yourself can contribute or not, please help us spread the word. Please forward this to your friends and acquaintances who love trees or children or both!

Thank you!!

Thank you!!

story:
The Boise EcoComplex will be a carbon neutral, multi-source and use energy complex to improve the environmental quality and economic stability of Boise, Idaho. The complex will incorporate anaerobic digestion, green waste and water re-use, solar thermal and photo-voltaic technology, methane capture, CO2 capture, and aquaculture to produce food and energy and process waste without releasing pollutants into the atmosphere.

The initial funding for this project is for viability of the facility. The project funding provided by this campaign will complete the following:

Initial design and feasability study.

This is a community project. Boise is an amazing place to grow up and raise a family and I want to do everything I can to continue to make this available for my children.

The return for contributing is first, your name (or the name of a loved one) on the project, and second, a voice. We will conduct quarterly board meetings and as a contributor, you become a lifetime member of the board. The board will review the latest advancements in renewable energy technology and make decisions regarding future plans for the Boise EcoComplex. The EcoComplex will evolve as the technology does and will have the agility to adapt.

The Impact

You can be a part of:

  • The end of Boise’s winter inversion.
  • The beginning of Boise’s energy independence.
  • A project you, your children, and/or your parents can be proud of.

Other Ways You Can Help

You don’t have to contribute cash to make a difference. You can help by getting the word out and sharing this idea:

  • Please share this project with your friends
  • use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Share us on Facebook, Google+ and other places we will be seen.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
My name is Conor McManamy and I’m a high school student in Newburyport, Massachusetts. A coastal community known for its cultural history, historic buildings, and beautiful location at the junction of the Merrimack River and the Atlantic Ocean, Newburyport has been invaded by a new threat: the disposable plastic grocery bag. These thin-plastic bags have been busy. With their large handles and lightweight design, these bags have been spotted hanging in trees, embarking on sea expeditions, and making stops in storm drains, recycling centers, and boat motors. In general, these bags have been having quite the time negatively affecting the town I grew up in.

Some facts about these thin-film plastic grocery bags:

  • They are lightweight and aerodynamic, so they take flight from our parking lots and garbage cans and blow around our neighborhoods. They also get caught in trees and float out to sea from our riverfront.


  • They are a threat to wildlife. Plastic bags are often mistaken for food (some marine animals take them for jellyfish) by turtles, whales, seals, birds and fish. In the summer, while many tourists line up to take a boat from Newburyport to watch the majestic whales off our coast, plastic bags choke, strangle, and entangle these already endangered whales.


  • They are part of a growing plastic litter problem, with 100 billion such bags thrown away each year in the US alone (5 trillion worldwide). Only 5% are recycled. They do not biodegrade, but simply break down into smaller bits, forming a toxic plastic soup in our oceans and litter on our beaches. According to the National Geographic, there is a garbage patch that stretches the distance from Cuba to Virginia off our east coast, similar in make-up (mostly plastic) to its Pacific counterpart: the better-known Great Pacific Garbage Patch.


  • Although the average use of these bags is only 15 minutes, these bags remain on Earth forever.


  • Communities worldwide are banning these bags. This year, China has banned them, joining the growing list of regions where bans or taxes are used to limit the use of these bags: South Africa, Rwanda, India, Italy, Los Angeles County, Hawaii, and hundreds of towns and cities. Here in Massachusetts, five towns have banned the bags, with many other bans under consideration statewide.



In Newburyport, I am part of a group that has worked to educate people about alternatives for the thin-film plastic grocery bag. The group, Citizens for Sustainable Bagging, showed the documentary film “Bag It” at a number of venues and over 20 times on cable TV. They have held forums and surveyed both merchants and residents about their opinions. Our community has begun a dialogue prompted by a city council ordinance currently under consideration that will limit the use of these bags. One of the comments we have heard is that we must make reusable bags available.

So now we are creating reusable bags that we will sell at a very affordable price so that everyone can use reusable bags instead of plastic for their groceries. Will you help us? We are getting ready to order a lot of reusable bags and sell them this summer to tourists and residents. The bag includes handles to make shopping easier, and is made of non-woven polypropylene which provides a lightweight, durable, and washable design. 

 

Even better, Newburyport High School students held a design contest to propose a design for the bag, promoting Newburyport as a green community. Out of the 54 entries, we chose a winning design which will be displayed on the bags.

What we need:

We’re asking backers to invest in a greener earth by donating funds to make this project come alive. We already have a loan commitment of $2,500 which will be repaid when we sell the bags.  So now, we need smaller individual donations to cover the fixed production expenses for the bags. 

All our profits will be donated to the Massachusetts Sierra Club.

Will you help us?

If you can’t spare any money to donate, spread the word and help our campaign reach our goal!
